title: Pereira on team news, 'playing with courage' and Fenerbahce return
description: Nottingham Forest boss Vitor Pereira has been speaking to the media before Thursday's Europa League play-off first leg at Fenerbahce (kick-off 17:45 GMT).  Pereira confirmed defender Murillo has trained with the side and is in contention for Thursday's game.
fullText:
Nottingham Forest boss Vitor Pereira has been speaking to the media before Thursday's Europa League play-off first leg at Fenerbahce (kick-off 17:45 GMT).

Here are the key lines from his news conference:

Pereira confirmed defender Murillo has trained with the side and is in contention for Thursday's game. However, Stefan Ortega has replaced Matz Sels in the Europa League squad, although the new boss insisted the goalkeeper's injury is not long term and he is "recovering well".

The head coach, who has joined on an 18-month contract, says he is "very confident" about the role because that is "my character, my personality", and added: "I recognise the quality in my players, in the squad. We just need the click, the win, to start to be more confident."

On his first days at the club and what he can change for this game: "The most important thing is my opinion. In two days, you cannot come with a lot of information. You must be intelligent to give a clear message here tactically. You know I like to play tactically in a way, and this is something that cannot change in two days."

Pereira added: "Since the first day, I believe we can start to create identity, this is the way we want to play, and if players buy the idea and they feel they can be important in the idea then this is the way to achieve our target."

On playing in the atmosphere of a stadium like Fenerbahce's: "For the players, this is the atmosphere that they enjoy to play in. They enjoy to play in this kind of energy. For me, it is a pleasure to be here and to face a team with passion and to show our passion, show our energy, show our ambition. To play with courage and organisation."

Asked about the difficulty of playing with that courage in their current run of form, he responded: "Since the first day you can start to give this energy to them. I believe that a team absorbs a lot of the passion and personality of the manager. We need to think about the game tomorrow as an opportunity to show our qualities, to prove ourselves, and to be proud at end of game with what we did."

Having had two spells at Fenerbahce, Pereira knows they are facing a "tough game" but is also expecting one with "quality" as there is "a lot talent on the pitch".

Listen to live commentary of Fenerbahce v Nottingham Forest at 17:45 on Thursday on BBC Radio Nottingham

Got a question about Forest? Get in touch here and we'll put it to our experts

title: USA vs Sweden hockey live updates: Time, channel for Olympics quarterfinal
description: The United States and Sweden are facing each in the men's hockey quarterfinals at the 2026 Winter Olympics. Here are live updates and how to watch:
fullText:
MILAN - As the USA men's hockey team faces its biggest challenge yet in the quarterfinals of the 2026 Winter Olympics, it helps to know whose behind them.

Connor Hellebuyck has been the team's go-to guy in net, playing in two of the three preliminary games.

"He's a gamer," teammate Dylan Larkin said of Hellebuyck ahead of the quarterfinal against Sweden on Feb. 18 at Milano Santagiulia Ice Hockey Arena. "I believe in him. No one else I'd want to have the net than him. I learned quickly last year at the 4 Nations giving up a big chance or something happens and you're like, 'Oh, we got that guy.' It's kind of nice."

Behind Hellebuyck, there's Jeremy Swayman, who played in USA's game vs. Denmark, and Jake Oettinger, who has yet to see action.

More: Olympics men's hockey quarterfinals: What to watch for, predictions

USA held practice in preparation for the game on Feb. 17.

NBC is broadcasting the game. Peacock is live streaming it.

The 12 teams are divided into three groups. They are:

Group A: Canada, Switzerland, Czechia, France

Group B: Finland, Sweden, Slovakia, Italy

Group C: USA, Germany, Latvia, Denmark

Teams play one game each against the other three teams in their group. Countries get three points for a regulation win, two for an overtime win, one for an overtime/shootout loss and zero for a regulation loss.

After the preliminary round is complete, teams are seeded 1 through 12 under the following criteria:

Higher number of goals scored for

The top four teams (group winners and best second-place team) get a bye to the quarterfinals. Teams 5-12 play in a qualifying round, with the winners going to the quarterfinals.

Playoff qualification games are on Feb. 17, quarterfinals are Feb. 18 and semifinals are Feb. 20.

The bronze medal game is Feb. 21 and the gold medal game is Sunday, Feb. 22.

This article originally appeared on USA TODAY: USA vs Sweden hockey live updates: How to watch men's quarterfinals

title: Amber Glenn Shares Positive Messages After Breaking Down in Tears from Disappointing Olympics Performance
description: The Team USA skater fell to 13th place after flubbing a jump during her short program
fullText:
Amber Glenn is sharing her current mood after a disappointing short program at the 2026 Milan Cortina Winter Olympics

The Texas native popped out of a triple jump and dropped to 13th place

Glenn, a mental health advocate, shared two positive messages on social media on Wednesday

Amber Glenn says she is ‚Äúcoping well‚Äù one day after skating a disappointing short program that landed her in 13th place at the 2026 Milan Cortina Winter Olympics.

On Tuesday, Feb. 17, the Team USA skater, 26, started strong, landing her triple axel. But she flubbed a jump when she popped out of a triple toe loop,¬†which hurt her final score.

Afterwards, Glenn was seemingly inconsolable as she tearfully skated off the ice to the kiss-and-cry area where she received her score, 67.39, more than 11 points off the lead.

The following day, the Plano, Texas native shared two posts on social media that gave a status update on her current mood on the eve of Thursday‚Äôs final.

‚ÄúLanding my highest scoring 3Axel,‚Äù she wrote over a video of herself celebrating, before she then hung her head, ‚ÄúMessing up the last jump and getting it invalidated.‚Äù

‚ÄúI'm coping well thanks for asking ü§™‚Äù Glenn captioned the TikTok.

Never miss a story ‚Äî 

On her Instagram Stories, the U.S. national champ shared an adorable image of a dog wearing a baseball cap with an inspirational message.

‚ÄúThe world has ended for me many times and yet tomorrow still comes. Keep going,‚Äù the post read.

Coming into the Olympics, Glenn was a favorite, having earned eight individual first-place finishes since 2024. The athlete, an outspoken mental health advocate, has also won the last three U.S. championships, according to NBC Sports.

During the Games, she won a gold medal as part of the team skating event.

When she skated off the ice in Milan on Tuesday, commentator Tara Lipinski articulated what many fans were thinking.

‚ÄúThis is heartbreaking to watch,‚Äù the 1998 Winter Olympics gold medalist said.

Teammate Alysa Liu‚Äôs short program was a success, landing her in third place going into Thursday, but it was Glenn‚Äôs emotional state that was on her mind.

‚ÄúShe‚Äôs gone through so much and she works so friggen‚Äô hard, like genuinely, such a hard worker and she‚Äôs overcome a lot,‚Äù Liu told reporters, including PEOPLE. ‚ÄúI just want her to be happy. That‚Äôs genuinely all I want. And so I‚Äôll be seeing her later, don‚Äôt worry guys. We‚Äôll stick together.‚Äù

To learn more about all the Olympic and Paralympic hopefuls, come to people.com to check out ongoing coverage before, during and after the games. Watch the Milan Cortina Olympics and Paralympics, beginning Feb. 6, on NBC and Peacock.

title: New lawsuit makes domestic violence allegations against Rashee Rice
description: NFL previously opened an investigation after abuse allegations emerged on Instagram.
fullText:
Earlier this year, domestic violence allegations against Chiefs receiver Rashee Rice surfaced on Instagram. New allegations have emerged against Rice in a lawsuit that was initiated earlier this week.

Via James Newell of The Athletic, the civil complaint filed Monday in Dallas County District Court includes the following contentions: "Defendant Rashee Rice and Plaintiff Dacoda Jones lived together. Following an escalation in violent behavior, in December, 2023, Defendant Rashee Rice strangled Plaintiff Dacoda Joans [sic] at their shared home in Victory Park, Texas. Defendant Rashee Rice continued to repeatedly assaulted Dacoda Jones over the course of their relationship through July, 2025. Defendant Rice has grabbed, choked, strangled, pushed, thrown, scratched, hit, and headbutted Ms. Jones, as well as hit her with inanimate objects. Additionally, he has engaged in other violent and abusive behaviors towards Ms. Jones, including throwing objects, destroying property, punching walls, and breaking furniture, as well as locking her out in the middle of the night. Many of these behaviors occurred while Ms. Jones was pregnant."

The league previously commenced a review based on the allegations from Instagram. The league undoubtedly will expand the investigation to include the claims made in the new lawsuit.

Rice served a six-game suspension to start the 2025 season, following a guilty plea to a March 2024 street-racing incident. His history could result in enhanced penalties, if the league finds he violated the Personal Conduct Policy again.

The situation also potentially impacts Rice's probation resulting from the street-racing incident. The agreement was announced in July; if any potential abuse occurred after the five-year period of probation commenced, he could face an argument that he violated the terms of his probation.

title: Longhorns baseball star Ethan Mendoza is off to hot start at plate
description: Through the first week of the college baseball season, Texas Longhorns second baseman Ethan Mendoza has been on a tear on the plate.
fullText:
Through the Longhorns' first four games of the 2026 campaign, their offense has looked unstoppable, scoring 41 runs. While they have gotten contributions from everyone, Ethan Mendoza is one player who has stood out. The Texas native was one of the Longhorns' best hitters last season and has picked up where he left off.

As Texas has gotten off to an undefeated start, Mendoza has posted a .375 batting average in 16 at-bats. In that stretch, the Southlake Carroll alum has added two home runs and seven RBI to his resume. While it is only a small sample size, Mendoza has shown great plate discipline, drawing four walks.

Ethan Mendoza (@SCSpikes '23) started his 2026 campaign flexing his üí™ for @TexasBaseball with ü§ò üí£ s!

The junior hit five last season and led the team with a .333 batting average. pic.twitter.com/VajvsLxpVB

‚Äî MLB Draft League (@mlbdraftleague) February 16, 2026

While Mendoza has made headlines with his bat, he has caused some chaos on the basepaths. The Longhorns infielder has two stolen bases after finishing last season with 15. If he can continue to add speed to his game to go with above-average power, he will be a matchup nightmare for pitchers. For the Longhorns, that would be a welcome development as they chase a national title.

After breaking onto the scene during the 2025 campaign, Mendoza is showing that his success as a sophomore was no fluke. He finished his first season in the Forty Acres with a .333 batting average in 56 games. The Longhorns' star also drove in 35 runs and recorded five home runs and four triples.

Texas 2B Ethan Mendoza is a MENACE. The kid has never stopped hitting going back to his high school days.

But with one small change, could he unlock an entirely new gear?

üëáSTORYüëá pic.twitter.com/ZCHytmNTkn

‚Äî Over-Slot Baseball (@OverSlot_) December 29, 2025

With the regular season far from over, Mendoza will have plenty of time to build on his success. He is an elite hitter and is drawing the attention of scouts for MLB teams with every line drive he hits. Although the Longhorns have high expectations this year, Mendoza is showing early on that he can be a catalyst for a team looking to bring a title to Austin.

This article originally appeared on Longhorns Wire: Texas baseball 2B Ethan Mendoza picks up where he left off last season

fullText:
Tara Lipinski shared a pair of sleek new photos from Milan, Italy, in her Sunday, February 15 Instagram post that she playfully called her ‚ÄúOlympic concourse fashion ‚ú®.‚Äù

The 43-year-old former Olympic gold medalist and current sports commentator working at the 2026 Winter Olympics wore a fitted white midi dress with subtle ruching that enhanced the clean, sculptural lines of the look. The minimalist silhouette was paired with metallic pointed-toe heels and added a reflective pop that complements the modern architectural backdrop. Her long blonde waves sat over one shoulder, bringing softness to the otherwise structured setting.

The two images showed Lipinski moving through the space, framed by angled concrete walls and geometric glass panels that double as mirrors.

title: 25 Years After Dale Earnhardt‚Äôs Death, NASCAR Still Races in His Shadow
description: On February 18, 2001, NASCAR experienced a moment that permanently divided its history into before and after. Dale Earnhardt, seven-time Cup Series champion and one of the most recognizable figures in American motorsports, was killed on the final lap of the Daytona 500. He was 49 years old, and the sport he helped define would never look the same again. Photo by princess photography on Pexels.com The crash occurred in Turn 4 as the field charged toward the checkered flag.
fullText:
On February 18, 2001, NASCAR experienced a moment that permanently divided its history into before and after. Dale Earnhardt, seven-time Cup Series champion and one of the most recognizable figures in American motorsports, was killed on the final lap of the Daytona 500. He was 49 years old, and the sport he helped define would never look the same again.

The crash occurred in Turn 4 as the field charged toward the checkered flag. Earnhardt was defending position behind his DEI teammates, Michael Waltrip and Dale Earnhardt Jr., when contact with Ken Schrader sent the No. 3 Chevrolet head-on into the outside wall. The car slid down into the infield grass, coming to rest as the race concluded and confusion began to ripple through the grandstands and television broadcast.

At 5:16 p.m. ET, Earnhardt was pronounced dead at Halifax Medical Center. What began as a routine final-lap crash became the most consequential day in modern NASCAR history.

The cruelty of that afternoon was rooted in contrast. Michael Waltrip had just earned his first Cup Series victory after more than 400 starts, and Dale Jr. finished second, giving Dale Earnhardt Incorporated a stunning 1-2 result in the sport‚Äôs biggest race. It should have been a celebration that echoed across the garage for years.

Instead, the emotional tone shifted in real time. Television coverage grew subdued. Drivers and crew members stood silently. The infield grass where the black No. 3 had come to rest became the focal point of an uneasy stillness. Although NASCAR had seen violent crashes before, this one carried a different gravity that became undeniable as time passed.

Earnhardt had built a reputation for walking away from hard hits. His toughness was part of his legend, and many fans initially assumed he would once again climb from the car. The confirmation that followed hours later sent shockwaves far beyond Daytona Beach and permanently altered how the sport would approach safety.

Statistics explain part of Earnhardt‚Äôs greatness, but they do not fully capture his presence. He won seven Cup Series championships, tying Richard Petty and Cale Yarborough. He earned 428 top-10 finishes, claimed 22 pole positions, and finally captured his long-awaited Daytona 500 victory in 1998 after years of near-misses on NASCAR‚Äôs biggest stage.

What separated Earnhardt from other champions was the way he controlled a race without always leading it. Competitors adjusted their lines when he filled their mirrors. Fans reacted viscerally to his every move, either cheering him with loyalty or booing him with equal intensity. He embodied a version of NASCAR that was raw, competitive, and unapologetically physical.

The nickname ‚ÄúThe Intimidator‚Äù was not a marketing invention; it was earned through decades of calculated aggression and racecraft. He understood drafting strategy at superspeedways better than most of his contemporaries and mastered the mental side of stock car racing. His influence extended beyond results and into the psychological fabric of the sport.

Earnhardt‚Äôs death forced NASCAR into a reckoning that had been building quietly for years. Safety equipment and structural improvements that had once been optional or inconsistently adopted became mandatory across the Cup Series. The HANS device was required. SAFER barriers were installed at tracks nationwide. Six-point harness systems and enhanced seat construction became standard components rather than upgrades.

These changes reshaped the physical risk landscape of NASCAR competition. Since February 2001, there have been no driver fatalities in the Cup Series, a statistic that underscores how dramatically the sport evolved in response to that loss. The reforms were not cosmetic adjustments; they were structural transformations that altered car design, track engineering, and driver expectations.

Every modern NASCAR driver competes in a machine influenced by the lessons learned from Turn 4 in 2001. The safety advances implemented in the aftermath stand as a lasting legacy tied directly to that day.

Twenty-five years later, the No. 3 remains one of the most recognizable numbers in racing. The black paint scheme and silver trim still carry emotional weight for longtime fans, while younger audiences understand its importance through history rather than firsthand experience. When NASCAR returns to Daytona each February, the memory of that final lap remains embedded in the narrative of the event.

Dale Earnhardt Jr. carried the family name into the modern era, becoming one of the sport‚Äôs most popular drivers while navigating the emotional complexity of racing at tracks so closely tied to his father‚Äôs legacy. The broader NASCAR community continues to reference Earnhardt‚Äôs competitive style and championship pedigree when debating the greatest drivers of all time.

The sport has evolved in technology, media exposure, and competitive structure, but Earnhardt‚Äôs shadow remains visible in each of those transitions. He represented a bridge between NASCAR‚Äôs regional roots and its national growth, helping to carry the sport into a new century before his life was cut short.

The 2001 Daytona 500 stands as both a tragic loss and a turning point. It marked the end of one era and accelerated the beginning of another defined by modern safety standards and heightened awareness of driver protection. NASCAR did not freeze in time after that day; it changed course.

Yet for all the innovation that followed, the memory of Dale Earnhardt continues to shape how fans and competitors interpret the sport‚Äôs identity. He was not simply one of its greatest champions; he was a defining figure whose presence extended beyond trophies and statistics. His career defined intensity, resilience, and a willingness to compete at the edge.

Twenty-five years later, NASCAR still races forward, but it does so with a clear understanding of what was lost and what was learned. Dale Earnhardt‚Äôs legacy lives not only in record books, but in the safety systems, cultural memory, and competitive spirit that continue to define the sport today.

title: Amber Glenn hopes she can still experience the Olympic moment of her dreams
description: U.S. figure skater Amber Glenn says she's hoping to achieve something more special to her than an Olympic medal during her free skate.
fullText:
The medal wasn‚Äôt what Amber Glenn wanted. When she botched the final jump of her otherwise faultless short program, it was the shattering of her dream that left Glenn more distraught than the score that dropped her to 13th place.

‚ÄúI was devastated that I lost the happiness and the enjoyment that I wanted to have out there on the ice to say, like, I fought for everything, I did everything I could,‚Äù Glenn said Wednesday after training at Milano Ice Skating Arena. ‚ÄúThat's what I truly wanted, and that's what I missed out on.‚Äù

Glenn was one jump away from her moment Tuesday. She aced her triple axel and got her combination jump. The crowd's excitement was building. Then she popped the final jump attempt, unraveling in the air and stopping short of the planned three revolutions. She clutched the necklaces on her dress at center ice afterward and sobbing while hugging her coach.

One of the leaders for building the team camaraderie that has defined this era of U.S. women‚Äôs figure skating, Glenn found comfort in her fellow ‚ÄúBlade Angel‚Äù Alysa Liu, who was quick to offer an encouraging hug. Glenn instead wanted Liu to enjoy her own moment after the 20-year-old from Oakland was third entering Thursday's free skate.

‚ÄúShe's super strong,‚Äù Liu said Tuesday night, ‚Äúso she can handle it.‚Äù

Liu, the reigning world champion, remains the United States‚Äô last, best hope for a figure skating medal in Milan. The United States has not won an Olympic medal in women's singles skating since 2006. Liu is only 2.12 points behind first-place Ami Nakai. Nakai‚Äôs Japanese teammate Kaori Sakamoto is second with 77.23 points, only 1.48 points behind her 17-year-old teammate and 0.64 points ahead of Liu.

The top six are separated by only 6.94 points after a competitive short program event that featured strong performances from most of the top contenders, including the United States‚Äô Isabeau Levito. The 2024 world silver medalist is in eighth, but just 5.75 points behind Liu. The difference could be equivalent to the base value of one triple jump.

The high standard set by other competitors made Glenn's singular mistake even more costly in the short program. While the free skate is more forgiving, the short program has seven specific requirements, including three for jumps. One jump has to be a double or triple axel. There has to be a jump combination that consists of a double jump and a triple jump or two triple jumps. And there has to be another triple jump.

So when the stand-alone triple loop toward the end of Glenn‚Äôs program turned into a double, it meant the entire element was void and she earned nothing for it. During the free skate, the same mistake would simply earn a lower base value.

The triple loop was the easiest jump in Glenn‚Äôs program and her favorite, she said. But she tapped her foot while spinning and lost her balance.

‚ÄúI was a little bit noodley,‚Äù Glenn said.

Still needing to perform three more required elements, Glenn tried to smile through her step sequence to save every fraction of a point she could. She has seen the stories of Norwegian Alpine skier Atle Lie McGrath trudging off the giant slalom course and lying in the snow after a mistake cost him a chance at a gold medal during these Games. She wished she had that option.

‚Äú[The judges] expect you to still perform like you're having the time of your life,‚Äù Glenn said, ‚Äúwhen, in reality, your dreams are just smashed to pieces.‚Äù

Glenn has shown her resilience already in Milan. She struggled on the first two elements of her free skate during the team competition but instead of crumbling the way she often did when she was younger, Glenn rallied to finish third. The United States held on to win the gold medal by one point. The moment was a testament to Glenn's growth, she said.

Years of mental preparation have helped Glenn get to the Olympic stage, but she said nothing could prepare her for the unique stress of the Games. She wanted to say that these experiences could serve as learning opportunities for her next Olympic run, but she knows that‚Äôs unlikely at this stage of her career.

Instead, Glenn‚Äôs experiences set an example for her teammates. The 18-year-old Levito, the youngest of the U.S. skaters, said she hopes to return to the Olympics in 2030 because Glenn has shown her what‚Äôs possible.

‚ÄúSeeing Amber being here at 26 is very inspiring and also kind of reassuring that I, in fact, could go so long,‚Äù Levito said. ‚ÄúShe's in her prime, I feel, at 26.‚Äù

The three-time U.S. champion still became an Olympic champion in Milan. Glenn already has her medal from the team event. Now she just wants her moment, the one she pictured as a child.

‚ÄúI always imagined, like, me doing like a spiral and looking up being like ‚ÄòI'm at the Olympics,'" Glenn said with optimism in her voice. ‚ÄúThat's what I want.‚Äù

This story originally appeared in Los Angeles Times.

title: Arkansas vs Alabama Prediction, Picks & Odds for Tonight's College Basketball Game
description: Darius Acuff shows the Crimson Tide why he's one of the nation's top guards as he highlights our Arkansas vs. Alabama picks, odds & expert predictions for Wednesday, February 18.
fullText:
Darius Acuff is one of the best guards in the country, and he hopes to leave Alabama with a win when they meet Arkansas.

Read why I‚Äôm grabbing the Over on his assist prop in my Arkansas vs. Alabama predictions and college basketball picks for Wednesday, February 18.

Darius Acuff is the primary transition pusher for the Hogs and a facilitator of pick-and-roll and pick-and-pop actions.

He's hit 5+ assists in four of his last five, including 7 and 9 dimes in his last two. In a game that should be insanely free-flowing, I expect Acuff to shine.

Alabama runs the fastest tempo in the country, and Arkansas isn't far behind. This Over is high, in fact, it‚Äôs very high, but even so, it seems like there‚Äôs still a little value in this number.

I paired it with Latrell Wrightsell to go Over 2.5 threes. The senior has 20 combined attempts from deep (!!!) over the last two games and should benefit from a game played so freely on the open floor.

Trevon Brazile is almost exclusively the only option for these actions, which makes a +150 price point on Over 1.5 threes very enticing. It leads the way on my long-shot parlay.

I paired it with Aden Holloway to go Over a low-assist number. It‚Äôs a play simply on a game that will be played at such a frantic pace, with the ball in his hands so often.

title: Arsenal could scrap warmups as their players keep getting injured
description: Arsenal players have recently been sustaining injuries during pre-match warm-ups, prompting the club to consider scrapping the routine altogether. The worrying pattern has raised concerns within the s...
fullText:
Arsenal players have recently been sustaining injuries during pre-match warm-ups, prompting the club to consider scrapping the routine altogether. The worrying pattern has raised concerns within the squad and coaching staff as they seek to protect key players during a demanding campaign.

Bukayo Saka and Riccardo Calafiori are among those who have suffered injuries during warm-ups shortly before kick-off. Such incidents have proven particularly frustrating, especially when players have already been named in the starting lineup, only to be ruled out moments before the match begins. The recurrence of these setbacks has intensified debate about whether changes to pre-match preparations are required.

This season has otherwise been a positive one for Mikel Arteta‚Äôs side, who have been widely regarded as the strongest team in England so far. Significant investment was made in squad depth during the summer transfer window, yet injuries have continued to disrupt their progress. Losing important players repeatedly has tested the resilience of the squad, despite the additional reinforcements.

The prospect of further injuries in the coming weeks remains a concern. However, the nature of these particular setbacks, occurring during warm-ups rather than in competitive action, has proven especially troubling. It has led to internal discussions about whether the traditional pre-match routine is contributing to the issue.

(Photo by Eddie Keogh/Getty Images)

As reported by Sports Illustrated, Mikel Arteta addressed the situation and suggested that the club may need to reevaluate its approach. He said, ‚ÄúTo change that sometimes is tricky.

‚ÄúIt is a really good area to have a look. What would happen if we don‚Äôt do the warmup? Because then. At half time, we go and sit almost for 15 minutes and then go full gas in the second half. Maybe it is something to think about.‚Äù

His comments reveal the seriousness with which the matter is being treated, as Arsenal explore possible adjustments to reduce the risk of further untimely injuries.

_____________________________________________________________________________________________

So here are some simple rules which I must insist commenters follow‚Ä¶.

You agree not to give any personal abuse to other Arsenal fans. Everyone is allowed to hold their own opinions even if you disagree with them. It COSTS NOTHING TO BE POLITE TO OTHER ARSENAL FANS.

CALLING ALL ARSENAL FANS! Anyone who would like to contribute an Article or Video opinion piece on JustArsenal, please contact us through this link‚Ä¶

title: O'Neill taken aback to reach 1,000 games as a manager
description: Celtic interim boss Martin O'Neill said he felt "real surprise" at being told he was going to take charge of his 1,000th game as a manager this week."It's a real surprise because I'd never counted the games, genuinely never," said O'Neill on Wednesday.
fullText:
Celtic interim boss Martin O'Neill said he felt "real surprise" at being told he was going to take charge of his 1,000th game as a manager this week.

The Northern Irishman will reach the landmark when Celtic host Stuttgart in their Europa League play-off first leg on Thursday.

O'Neill, 73, is in his second spell as interim coach this season after being in charge of the Glasgow giants from 2000-2005.

"It's a real surprise because I'd never counted the games, genuinely never," said O'Neill on Wednesday.

"So when the LMA (League Managers Association) told me yesterday about it, it did come as a big surprise to me.

"It's nice to do, really pleasing but I have to thank Celtic, otherwise it wouldn't have happened."

Celtic are unbeaten since O'Neill took charge again following the sacking of Wilfried Nancy in January.

They have since closed to within three points of Scottish Premiership leaders Hearts, with a game in hand, and reached the Europa League knock-out phase.

O'Neill, asked if he might extend his current Celtic stint beyond the end of this season, replied: "That's too far in the future for me, genuinely too far in the future."

Celtic are bidding to win a European knock-out tie for the first time since beating Barcelona in the 2003-04 UEFA Cup fourth round under O'Neill.

"This is a major test for us," said O'Neill of facing Stuttgart, who sit fourth in the Bundesliga.

"If you'd been having a conversation with me after Midtjylland (3-1 loss), you would have got long odds about being here this evening.

"We went to Feyenoord and got a great result (won 3-1) and fought with 10 men for about 60 minutes in the match against Bologna (2-2).

"I didn't want those games to not count for something."

title: The Seattle Seahawks are for sale
description: With the Lombardi Trophy secured, the Seahawks are officially in search of a new owner.
fullText:
It‚Äôs been barely a week since the Seattle Seahawks hoisted the Lombardi Trophy for the second time in franchise history, thumping the overpowered and overmatched New England Patriots 29-13 to lay claim to bragging rights as the best team in the league for the next year.

And now the franchise is officially for sale, with the team making an announcement Tuesday morning that the process of selling the team has begun, with investment banking firm Allen & Company retained to facilitate the sale.

Estate of Paul G. Allen Begins Sale Process for Seattle Seahawks pic.twitter.com/Toj3CjClzP

‚Äî Seattle Seahawks (@Seahawks) February 18, 2026

The team had been held in the estate of Paul Allen since his death in late 2018, with his sister Jody Allen filling in as acting owner since that time.

There has been no shortage of debate about when the team might be put up for sale, with reports on the eve of the Super Bowl indicating that the process of selling the team would be put up for sale after the season had concluded.

The season has now concluded, and the Seahawks are officially for sale.

title: India win despite third successive duck for world number one Sharma
description: Shivam Dube claims a half-century as India make hard work of a 17-run victory over the Netherlands to finish the T20 World Cup group stage unbeaten.
fullText:
Men's T20 World Cup, Group A, Ahmedabad

India 193-6 (20 overs): Dube 66 (31); Van Beek 3-56

Netherlands 176-7 (20 overs): De Leede 33 (23); Chakravarthy 3-14

India's world number one T20 batter Abhishek Sharma was out for a third consecutive duck at the World Cup but the hosts maintained their unbeaten tournament record with a 17-run victory over the Netherlands in Ahmedabad.

With Super 8s qualification already secured, India chose to bat first after winning the toss but their openers were stifled by the Netherlands' bowlers in the early overs.

Sharma faced just three balls before being dismissed by a back of the length delivery from Aryan Dutt, becoming the first batter in history to record three ducks in their first three innings of a T20 World Cup. He has five ducks in the calendar year.

But inspired batting further down the order saw India post an imposing 193-6, thanks to Shivam Dube's blistering 66 off 31 which featured four fours and six sixes.

Dube was backed up by Tilak Varma (31), Suryakumar Yadav (34) and Hardik Pandya (30). Aryan Dutt and Logan van Beek did attempt to slow down India's hard-hitting batters, picking up five wickets between them.

Having been knocked out of the competition after Pakistan's win over Namibia earlier in the day, the chase looked out of the Netherlands' reach from the outset.

Opening batters Michael Levitt and Max O'Dowd found it hard to get going as India spin bowler Varun Chakravarthy claimed a clinical 3-14 off his three overs.

Chakravarthy claimed revenge on behalf of team-mate Sharma by dismissing Dutt for a duck of his own, leaving the Netherlands 94-4 inside 13 overs.

Zach Lion-Cachet and Noah Croes hit some late boundaries but never threatened to overhaul the target, meaning India end Group A with an unblemished record of four wins from four matches.

title: The Seattle Seahawks are officially going up for sale
description: The Seattle Seahawks are officially for sale.
fullText:
The Seattle Seahawks are officially going up for sale.

The team posted a statement on X from the Estate of Paul G. Allen, saying that it has commenced a formal sale process for the NFL franchise, consistent with Allen‚Äôs directive to eventually sell his sports holdings and direct all Estate proceeds to philanthropy.

According to the statement, investment back Allen & Company and law firm Latham & Watkins will lead the sale process, which is estimated to continue through the 2026 off-season.

Estate of Paul G. Allen Begins Sale Process for Seattle Seahawks pic.twitter.com/Toj3CjClzP

‚Äî Seattle Seahawks (@Seahawks) February 18, 2026

Before the Super Bowl, sources told ESPN that there was a chance the team could be put up for sale after the big game.

At the time, the Paul G. Allen Estate shared the following statement with KIRO 7 News:

‚ÄúWe don‚Äôt comment on rumors or speculation, and the team is not for sale. We‚Äôve already said that will change at some point per Paul‚Äôs wishes, but there is no news to share. Our focus right now is winning the Super Bowl and completing the sale of the Portland Trail Blazers in the coming months.‚Äù

This is a developing story and will be updated when more information becomes available.

title: Mookie Betts Will Have MVP-Caliber Year, Dave Roberts Says
description: Los Angeles Dodgers skipper Dave Roberts says that he believes Mookie Betts will have an MVP season in 2026.
fullText:
Los Angeles Dodgers manager Dave Roberts belives superstar Mookie Betts will be in the MVP conversation this season.

Jack Vita of the Los Angeles Times shared Roberts comments via X.

‚ÄúMookie [Betts] will be in the MVP conversation this year,‚Äù Roberts said.

Los Angeles Dodgers manager Dave Roberts: ‚ÄúMookie [Betts] will be in the MVP conversation this year‚Äù

‚Äî Jack Vita (@JackVitaShow) February 18, 2026

Betts will have some competition this season, especially on his own team. The overwhelming favorite to win MVP this season in the National League is none other than Shohei Ohtani. The 31-year-old two-way superstar is at the top of the leader board, and that comes as no surprise.

Betts will have an uphill battle for that award, especially after the season he just endured. The Dodgers 2025 regular season was not magical at all, and neither was the four-time champions play.

In the season, the eight-time All-Star slashed .258/.326/.406 with a .732 OPS (the lowest of his career). Health was on Betts‚Äô side as he played 150 games; however, he was never able to find his groove.

Betts has finished inside the top 10 of MVP voting seven times in his career and in the top five five times. The Tennessee native is no stranger to MVP-level seasons; the only question is whether he can still produce at that level.

The six-time Gold Glove winner‚Äôs production has trended downward in recent seasons, and heading into Year 13, Father Time is beginning to loom. Fortunately for the Dodgers, they don‚Äôt need him to play superhero to contend.

The Dodgers are loaded with talent from top to bottom. If Betts is at least a bit better compared to last season, L.A. should have no problem cruising to their 10th title in franchise history.

Roberts said on Wednesday that he is leaning towards having Betts bat No. 3 in the order against both left and right handed pitching in 2026.

Since Ohtani arrived in Los Angeles, Betts was the No. 2 batter in the order. However, with a dip in productivity and the arrival of Kyle Tucker, that leaves Roberts with no choice. Still, Betts is expected to produce and¬†play a big role for L.A.

title: Kyler Murray‚Äôs future uncertain after update from Cardinals HC Mike LaFleur
description: GLENDALE ‚Äì Arizona Cardinals head coach Mike LaFleur was asked about the future of Kyler Murray in the desert. His answer? They are still having open roster conversations with no timetable.
fullText:
GLENDALE ‚Äì Arizona Cardinals head coach Mike LaFleur was asked about the future of Kyler Murray in the desert. His answer? They are still having open roster conversations with no timetable. In today‚Äôs NFL, that‚Äôs not nonchalant; that‚Äôs calculated with a message.

Arizona Cardinals new head coach Mike LaFleur at a news conference on Feb. 3, 2026, at Arizona Cardinals training center in Tempe. ¬© Rob Schumacher/The Republic / USA TODAY NETWORK via Imagn Images

This isn‚Äôt about performance alone. Murray has flashed incredible talent over his time in Arizona during his healthy stretches, but availability and trajectory matter. Since 2022, injuries have limited continuity, and Arizona‚Äôs roster has shifted toward a reset. Financially, the equation is delicate. Moving on from Murray would trigger significant dead money, but it could also unlock draft capital and schematic clarity. The Cardinals aren‚Äôt just evaluating a quarterback; they‚Äôre evaluating a timeline. Does Murray align with where the franchise will peak next?

Cardinals quarterback Kyler Murray gets wired up on the sidelines during a preseason game against the Raiders at State Farm Stadium in Glendale on Aug. 23, 2025. ¬© Patrick Breen/The Republic / USA TODAY NETWORK via Imagn Images

Around the league, quarterback demand never sleeps. Teams like the New York Jets, Minnesota Vikings, and Pittsburgh Steelers have all faced recent instability at the position. A trade market would exist; the question is whether Arizona believes Murray‚Äôs best football fits their future or someone else‚Äôs present, and can they even find a trade partner that will give Arizona a fair deal?

Oct 5, 2025; Glendale, Arizona, USA; Arizona Cardinals quarterback Kyler Murray (1) warms up before their game against the Tennessee Titans at State Farm Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Joe Camporeale-Imagn Images

For Cardinals fans, this isn‚Äôt abstract. It‚Äôs emotional. Murray was the No. 1 overall pick. He represented hope, explosiveness, and relevance. Moving on would signal a philosophical reset, and patience over potential. LaFleur‚Äôs short answer wasn‚Äôt indecision. It was leverage, as the Cardinals are weighing identity against investment. Although when a coach won‚Äôt define a quarterback‚Äôs future, the writing might be on the wall for what the future may hold.

Cardinals HC Mike LaFleur excited about Arizona‚Äôs new coaching staff

title: Born to ski: Experts and fans say Norway owes Olympic dominance to tradition, depth and development
description: After every victory, a gold sticker is pressed onto the board.  There have been plenty to add: Norway leads the medals table with 33 ‚Äî 15 gold, eight silver and 10 bronze.  The country‚Äôs Olympic arsenal this year is led by Johannes Hoesflot Klaebo, a cross-country skier and gold medal machine.
fullText:
TESERO, Italy (AP) ‚Äî Outside the Olympic cross-country stadium in the Dolomite mountains, Norwegian flags drape over the railings like bunting on a national holiday.

Fans from the Scandinavian country have set up camp nearby and keep a live tally of medals won by their athletes at the Milan Cortina Games. After every victory, a gold sticker is pressed onto the board.

There have been plenty to add: Norway leads the medals table with 33 ‚Äî 15 gold, eight silver and 10 bronze. And its dominance has raised a familiar question: What makes Norway, a nation of 5.6 million people, such a superpower on the snow at the world‚Äôs biggest winter sports event?

The country‚Äôs Olympic arsenal this year is led by Johannes Hoesflot Klaebo, a cross-country skier and gold medal machine. He has won five gold medals at the Milan Cortina Games to take his career tally to a Winter Games record of 10.

Klaebo earned his fifth gold on Wednesday in the men‚Äôs team sprint. He held off a late American charge to win in 18 minutes, 28.9 seconds.

The 29-year-old Klaebo, who is competing at his third Olympics, said the collective experience his team has built up is the key to winning races.

‚ÄúIn a team sprint, a lot of it is about staying in front and skiing as efficiently as possible. We know from experience that it‚Äôs usually decided on the final lap,‚Äù Klaebo said.

‚ÄúLuckily, I‚Äôve been in that position a few times now, and I feel comfortable there,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúWe just needed to enjoy it and stay in the mix ‚Äî and when it came down to the final sprint, that‚Äôs when it mattered. Today, that worked out perfectly.‚Äù

Many believe Klaebo‚Äôs remarkable golden run is a product of a system that has few equals in winter sports.

Katerina Neumannova, a retired Czech Olympic champion, points to Norway‚Äôs structure as the foundation of its success. Cross-country skiing is among the country‚Äôs most popular sports, with hundreds of clubs and large numbers of kids starting young.

‚ÄúWhen you have so many children, so many trainers and so many clubs all around Norway, it‚Äôs much easier to find special talent,‚Äù Neumannova told The Associated Press.

Norway, she said, has benefitted from the absence of the banned Russian team as well as having a concentration of talented team officials supporting athletes, and even the lack of snow in lower latitudes affecting mainland Europe.

And its depth of public participation, she argued, provides a steady supply of elite competitors.

‚ÄúOther countries usually have some gaps between generations, but the Norwegian team is very stable,‚Äù Neumannova said. ‚ÄúWhen one athlete ends, younger ones are already coming up.‚Äù

Klaebo‚Äôs race partner on Wednesday was Einar Hedegart, a 24-year-old Olympic rookie who shared gold in an earlier relay event and won bronze in the 10-kilometer interval start.

‚ÄúThere‚Äôs definitely some pressure that comes with racing alongside Johannes, so it‚Äôs both a relief and a joy to pull off here today,‚Äù Hedegart said after Wednesday‚Äôs race.

‚ÄúTo win two gold medals in my first (Olympic) championship is huge,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs an incredibly good feeling.‚Äù

A lot Norway‚Äôs supremacy stems from tradition as the cradle of Nordic skiing.

Ten medals ‚Äî six of them gold ‚Äî come from cross‚Äëcountry, and another nine from biathlon. Ski jumper Anna Odine Stroem swept both the normal and large hills, and added a silver in the mixed team event. Jens Luraas Oftebro took both Nordic combined titles.

The medals don‚Äôt stop there: Norway struck twice in freestyle skiing, picked up two in Alpine skiing, and completed the speedskating set with a gold, silver and bronze.

Finn Dahl, a superfan who did marketing for the 1994 Lillehammer Olympics at home in Norway, attributed his country's success to a way of life that revolves around snow.

Children, he said, often take trips with their families to the mountains, where skiing is just the normal way of getting around.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a natural way of sort of moving from one cabin to another,‚Äù Dahl said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a spirit, it is inside you.‚Äù

AP Winter Olympics: https://apnews.com/hub/milan-cortina-2026-winter-olympics

title: Ex-NBA Star Has Harsh Words For Chinese Olympian Eileen Gu On Fox News
description: The ex-New York Knick and former Turkish citizen went after the global superstar for representing her mom's home country in the Games.
fullText:
Ex-NBA star Enes Kanter Freedom piled on to the often-conservative criticism of freestyle skiing great Eileen Gu¬†on Wednesday.

Gu, whose mother is Chinese, was born in San Francisco but is representing China for the second straight Winter Olympics.

Politics: Trump's Latest Epstein Denial Has Critics Asking New Questions

She has earned China two silver medals in the Milan Cortina Games with the halfpipe up next. She won two golds and a silver in 2022. She has vaulted to international fame as an athlete and sometimes a model, reportedly earning tens of millions of dollars a year ‚Äï a chunk of which she has received from the Chinese government.

But as in the last Winter Olympics, Gu has gotten heat for her choice, though it should be noted that several U.S.-born athletes compete for other countries.¬†Brazil‚Äôs Lucas Pinheiro Braathen, who was born in Oslo but has a Brazilian mother, has been widely celebrated during the Games for representing a country other than his birthplace. Gu‚Äôs defenders have suggested that racism and Sinophobia are factors in why she is being treated differently.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm just going to say it. She‚Äôs a traitor,‚Äù Freedom told Fox News host Laura Ingraham on Wednesday. ‚ÄúShe was born in America. She was raised in America, lives in America, and chooses to compete against her own country for, literally, the worst human rights abuser on the planet, China. She built her fame in a free country, and then chooses to represent an authoritarian regime.‚Äù

Kanter Freedom: Eileen Gu Is a traitor. She was born in America and chooses to compete against her own country. pic.twitter.com/gAh4YbrFpt

‚Äî Acyn (@Acyn) February 18, 2026

The former center, who played for the Utah Jazz, New York Knicks and other teams in the NBA from 2011 to 2022, added ‚ÄúFreedom‚Äù to his name¬†when he became a U.S. citizen in 2021. The former Turkish citizen was outspoken against the Turkish government and had his passport canceled by the country in 2017. He often¬†speaks out against human rights abuses in China.

Before the Games, Gu defended her choice to represent China.

Politics: Money And Power Converge As CBS Becomes Trump State Media

‚ÄúThe U.S. already has the representation,‚Äù Gu said, per Newsweek. ‚ÄúI like building my own pond.‚Äù

She also dismissed speculation that she chose China because the financial windfall was potentially greater.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm glad that there‚Äôs enough money in the sport now for people to think that‚Äôs a consideration,‚Äù Gu said.

Like this article? Keep independent journalism alive. Support HuffPost.

Even Vice President JD Vance weighed in about Gu‚Äôs decision, starting off diplomatically but eventually throwing some shade her way.

Asked by Fox News‚Äô Martha MacCallum on Tuesday if the status of the San Francisco-born athlete should be ‚Äúchanged,‚Äù the veep replied:¬†‚ÄúWell, look, I have no idea what her status should be. I think that‚Äôs ultimately up to the Olympics Committee. I won‚Äôt pretend to wade into that.‚Äù

Politics: Homeland Security Flack Tricia McLaughlin Set To Leave Trump Administration

‚ÄúI certainly think that somebody who grew up in the United States of America, who benefited from our education system, from the freedoms and liberties that make this country a great place, I would hope that they want to compete with the United States of America,‚Äù he added.

‚ÄúSo, I‚Äôm going to root for American athletes, and I think part of that is people who identify themselves as Americans. That‚Äôs who I‚Äôm rooting for this Olympics,‚Äù Vance said.

title: Lindsey Vonn shares emotional update after Olympic crash as personal loss comes to light
description: In the middle of what was already shaping up to be one of the most physically grueling stretches of her Olympic return, Skiing icon Lindsey Vonn has now shared a deeply personal loss that puts everything into perspective. Days after‚Ä¶
fullText:
In the middle of what was already shaping up to be one of the most physically grueling stretches of her Olympic return, Skiing icon Lindsey Vonn has now shared a deeply personal loss that puts everything into perspective.

Days after suffering a frightening crash at the 2026 Winter Olympics in Milano Cortina, the skiing icon revealed she was quietly dealing with heartbreak far beyond the slopes.

On February 18, Vonn announced that her beloved dog Leo had passed away on February 9 following a recent battle with lung cancer, just one day after her Olympic crash.

MORE: Lindsey Vonn injury update is encouraging, but ‚Äòleg still in pieces‚Äô

She opened up about her dog‚Äôs passing on X. ‚Äú2/9/2026

Leo passed away. The day after my crash I said goodbye to my big boy as I laid in my hospital bed. Been some of the hardest days of my life and still have not begun to process his passing. I will always love you Leo

Leo passed away. The day after my crash I said goodbye to by my big boy as I laid in my hospital bed. Been some of the hardest days of my life and still have not begun to process his passing‚Ä¶ 

I will always love you Leo

‚Äî lindsey vonn (@lindseyvonn) February 18, 2026

In her emotional post on Instagram, Lindsey Vonn said Leo had been by her side since her second ACL injury in 2013, when she needed him the most, helping her through some of the lowest points of her career. She added that he stayed close to her during recovery, even lying beside her on the couch as she watched the Sochi Olympics while sidelined from competition.

Vonn explained that Leo had recently been diagnosed with lung cancer after previously surviving lymphoma about a year and a half ago, but his health had rapidly declined as his heart began to fail. She noted that he was in significant pain toward the end, and the day after her Olympic crash, she had to say goodbye to him from her hospital bed.

She further shared that over the past 13 years, Leo had consistently lifted her spirits during injuries and personal struggles, always making her feel safe and supported through difficult moments.

Vonn also said she believes he is now at peace and reunited with Lucy, Bear, and several loved ones she has lost in recent years, describing Leo as someone who would always remain her first love. She added that she was heading in for another surgery while continuing to cope emotionally with the loss.

Leo had been by Lindsey Vonn‚Äôs side for more than a decade after coming into her life during her 2013 ACL injury. Over the years, he became a constant source of emotional support through multiple career setbacks, recovery periods, and personal challenges. As the Olympic skier describes, her dog has been her first love.

title: Eddie Hearn‚Äôs Matchroom announces new DAZN streaming deal
description: Having first signed a deal with DAZN in 2018, Matchroom will continue with the streaming platform
fullText:
Matchroom Boxing has announced a new deal with DAZN, as the promotion extends its contract with the streaming platform until 2031.

Matchroom initially signed with DAZN in 2018, penning a five-year deal after splitting from Sky Sports. They then renewed for 3 years in 2023. Matchroom Boxing have also signed a new partnership with DAZN‚Äôs Foxtel Group in Australia, bringing seven major events to Australian audiences on Kayo Sports.

The a new five-year deal is set to keep the likes of Anthony Joshua, Katie Taylor, Conor Benn, Shakur Stevenson, Dmitry Bivol, Jesse ‚ÄúBam‚Äù Rodriguez, and Ben Whittaker on DAZN until 2031 ‚Äì barring any retirements or fresh promotional contracts elsewhere.

Per a press release issued on Wednesday, the new deal concerns the UK and US, and will bring ‚Äúmore than 30 shows globally per year‚Äù.

Matchroom Boxing chairman Eddie Hearn said: ‚ÄúDAZN is the only partner that matches our ambitions for boxing. Their global platform, investment, passion and commitment to boxing make them the perfect partner for [our] fighters and events. This new deal in two of the world‚Äôs most important boxing markets reinforces our belief and trust in DAZN, and the scale of what we can achieve together.‚Äù

Joshua‚Äôs last fight actually took place on Netflix, where DAZN permitted the former heavyweight champion to box Jake Paul in December. Joshua, 36, stopped the influencer in six rounds in Miami, just days before suffering injuries in a fatal car crash in Nigeria.

Joshua‚Äôs boxing future is up in the air following that accident, in which ‚ÄúAJ‚Äù was a passenger and his teammates Sina Ghami and Latif ‚ÄúLatz‚Äù Ayodele were killed.

Furthermore, with all-time great Taylor nearing retirement at 39 years old, DAZN will likely look to younger Matchroom talents like Benn, Stevenson, Rodriguez and Whittaker to carry the brand going forward.

Stevenson last boxed in January, outpointing fellow American Teofimo Lopez with a masterful performance. That victory kept Stevenson, 28, unbeaten and saw him win a world title at a fourth weight.

After that bout in New York City, 29-year-old Benn entered the Madison Square Garden ring to face off with Stevenson.

Meanwhile, British talent Whittaker is slowly building towards the prospect of a world-title shot at light-heavyweight, having made his Matchroom debut in November. On that occasion, he stopped Benjamin Gavazi in the first round.

Bivol, recently undisputed at light-heavyweight, is eyeing a return to the ring later this year after recovering from injury, while Rodriguez is establishing himself as a top pound-for-pound talent.

title: Rock blames bathroom soap for poor Antwerp display
description: Josh Rock blames his error-strewn display in his 6-2 defeat by Michael van Gerwen in night two of Premier League darts in Antwerp on the soap he used in the bathroom before going on stage.
fullText:
Josh Rock blamed his error-strewn display in last week's 6-2 Premier League defeat by Michael van Gerwen in Antwerp on the soap he used in the bathroom before going on stage.

The 24-year-old was seen wiping his hands on his trousers multiple times and licking his fingers at one stage during the quarter-final contest.

Northern Ireland's Rock believes his inability to grip the darts properly was caused by the soap and he has now sought to guard against it happening to him at future events by packing his own chalk and wax.

"I went to the toilet just before I went on stage and obviously you wash your hands after going to the toilet, so I put the soap all over my hands and the next minute I'm up there, and I was like, 'This isn't going to go well'," he said.

"I just could not feel it at all. So now we've got a plan B, I've got a bit of chalk and wax in the case from now on.

"I didn't have to use it this week at the Players Championship, it was fine, but it must have been the soap I used.

"That was the first time it's happened. It must be just whatever soap was in the toilet at Antwerp that I used and it just obviously took all the oils out of my finger and lost all grip."

World number nine Rock admitted his natural reaction to his struggles against seven-time champion Van Gerwen was to "laugh straight away" because he "knew what the problem was".

He has now put that performance down to misfortune and moved on as he prepares to take on world number two Luke Humphries in night three of the competition in Glasgow on Thursday before competing in front of a home crowd in Belfast on 26 February.

"If I played like that and didn't know what the problem was then, obviously we have an issue," he added.

"But I knew I couldn't grip my hands and no matter how much I was trying to lick my fingers, rub my finger up and down a barrel to get my fingers rough, it wasn't working, so I just let that one go."

title: NASCAR officials address holding the caution, fuel saving tactics at Daytona
description: There's no real shift in any policy and race control made decisions based on driver feedback
fullText:
It appeared over the weekend that NASCAR implemented a new policy that made an extra effort to not reasonably throw a caution on the final lap of a superspeedway race.

It appeared that way because NASCAR evenly applied that stance in both the Truck and Cup race across two different race directors. But also, throughout the weekend, solo car spins without any additional contact that unevenly drew cautions prior to this weekend did not.

There looked like a concerted effort to be more cautious with the caution.

Cup Series managing director Brad Moran was on SiriusXM NASCAR Radio on Wednesday morning and said the Sanctioning Body was more fortunate that the incidents under this particular microscope didn‚Äôt result in a yellow flag, circumstantially.

‚ÄúThe race directors did a great, great job this weekend,‚Äù Moran said. ‚ÄúChase Brashears called the Truck and the O'Reilly Race and Tim Bermann called the Cup Race. The Cup race was a little more challenging but we have a lot of resources. We have turn spotters, cameras and replay, a lot of folks in the tower. We have remote race control.

‚ÄúWe have all these resources that communicate to us, and we felt there was nothing that we had to immediately go out ‚Ä¶ we were still monitoring the situation in (Turn 1) and we were able to let that one play out to the start-finish line.

‚ÄúObviously, the caution came out when the leaders got together right at start-finish line. They crossed over it under green and then the caution flew. That‚Äôs all within a split second. So we definitely held it as long as we could but we would try to do that last year, the year before and nothing changed. It just laid out that we could do it at this particular race.‚Äù

On NASCAR‚Äôs Hauler Talk podcast, league managing director of communications Mike Forde says they were bailed out by Daytona‚Äôs significant run-off area and that this may not play out the same on the last lap this weekend at Atlanta.

‚ÄúWe may see a hit that looks hard, a nose-into-the-wall collision that bent the front clip, and we need to get safety trucks out there as soon as possible,‚Äù Forde said. ‚ÄúWe did not see that in Daytona.

‚ÄúOr that same type of wreck could happen, but the runoff area in Atlanta is nonexistent. There is a ton of runoff area in Daytona. And so because of that, they were able to get out of harm‚Äôs way. In Atlanta, that probably won‚Äôt be the case, so there may be a flag. We are going to do our best to maintain consistency. That is the ultimate goal, but every wreck is a snowflake. No two wrecks are the same, and because we‚Äôre at a different track, it changes the game.‚Äù

The only recent change, says Forde, is that NASCAR will be more diligent about throwing a caution if drivers would need to traverse at speed through a debris field, which came up after the Daytona 500 last year.

‚ÄúThat was kind of a line in the sand of moving forward, this is the philosophy,‚Äù Forde said.

And those evolving decisions are based on communication with the Driver Advisory Council through consultant Jeff Burton.

‚ÄúThey‚Äôre making sure that the drivers feel that what we did (at Daytona) was correct,‚Äù Forde said. ‚ÄúAnd if they have any feedback, we‚Äôll absolutely take it. ‚Ä¶ We want to make sure that the drivers feel comfortable, and that‚Äôs why we changed on the debris field philosophy. That was direct driver feedback from the likes of Denny Hamlin, Christopher Bell and others who said, ‚ÄòDon‚Äôt put us in a situation where we‚Äôve just got to go 100 percent throttle and hope for the best.‚Äô You can‚Äôt have that.‚Äù

Denny Hamlin endorsed the approach this weekend as long as there is continued consistency.

‚ÄúWell, I think everyone is okay with whatever it is, as long as it's consistent,‚Äù Hamlin said. ‚ÄúSomebody said, as long as it's the same for all races, and this weekend, they were very consistent. So I don't think anyone should have any gripes about that.

‚ÄúWe saw they set the tone really on Friday, and so they let those guys race it out.

‚ÄúI was on the other end of the track. I can tell you that I didn't think I was in any danger or the cars -- the ones that did wreck in Turn 1, they ended up all in the apron of the grass so they were off the racing surface. There might have been one kind of running the apron or limping home, but there was no more traffic to go through there.

‚ÄúIt seems like how they're calling this now is that if you have to drive back through it, if there's multiple cars that's got to drive through it and somebody is on the racetrack, they're going to call the caution. But it seemed like to me when I drove through there 30 seconds later, nobody on the racetrack had any -- was in any danger. I was fine with it.‚Äù

Denny Hamlin has a Daytona 500 fuel saving pitch that involves The Clash

NASCAR on superspeedway fuel saving: 'What are we trying to fix?'

NASCAR also continues to listen to fans and consider what changes could be made after another Daytona 500 featured large portions of the race asking drivers to ride in a pack at 50-60 percent throttle.

They do this to spend less time taking fuel on pit road so they can try to pick up track position that way with passing so challenging in the pack.

Moran says they‚Äôre not oblivious to fan sentiment.

‚ÄúYeah sure,‚Äù Moran said on Sirius. ‚ÄúWe have a lot of fan councils and we listen. We listen to the fans and the industry. But, I don‚Äôt know when the last time you went 165 or whatever miles per hour, three-wide down the highway and it‚Äôs quite entertaining when they‚Äôre doing it.

‚ÄúBut we understand what folks are saying. It‚Äôs not an easy fix but we‚Äôve had meeting with industry members and crew chiefs have told us this is a tool in their tool box that they‚Äôve learned over the years. This group is best at taking advantage of any situation and that‚Äôs how they win races.

‚ÄúTelling them to stop that isn‚Äôt really going to work. It is on our radar and we‚Äôre certainly looking into it. But there isn‚Äôt really one thing that we can flip the switch and change it. This is being discussed within the industry.‚Äù

Forde echoed that sentiment on his podcast too.

‚ÄúGetting rid of that entirely is probably not going to happen, but that doesn‚Äôt mean that we‚Äôre not going to try and work at it,‚Äù Forde said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs something on the docket. Fans wanted change in the playoffs, we did that. Fans wanted more horsepower, we did that. Fans wanted to change the (Charlotte) Roval to the oval, we did that. So this is also on the list of fan feedback, so we‚Äôll see. TBD and no real answers yet, but it‚Äôs something that‚Äôs on the list.‚Äù

All the reasons why the Daytona 500 meant so much to Tyler Reddick

Daytona 500 win special for Tyler Reddick spotter Nick Payne

To read more Motorsport.com articles visit our website.

title: 3 Detroit Lions Included in 2026 NFL Free Agency Rankings
description: Three Detroit Lions landed in early 2026 NFL free agency rankings. Here‚Äôs what it means for Detroit.
fullText:
As the Detroit Lions continue to balance a win-now roster with long-term cap flexibility, it‚Äôs no surprise to see several key contributors showing up in early 2026 NFL free agency rankings.

According to Daniel Popper of The Athletic, three Lions defenders landed inside his positional rankings ahead of the 2026 offseason, a reminder that Detroit‚Äôs depth and development on defense hasn‚Äôt gone unnoticed around the league.

Here‚Äôs a closer look at the Lions players who made the list and what it could mean for Brad Holmes‚Äô offseason decisions.

Veteran linebacker Alex Anzalone checks in at No. 49 overall in Popper‚Äôs rankings, with a projected contract of two years, $21 million.

Anzalone has quietly been one of the most reliable pieces of Detroit‚Äôs defense over the past five seasons. He‚Äôs averaged nearly 100 tackles per year with the Lions and continues to thrive as a rangy, athletic off-ball linebacker.

Popper highlights Anzalone‚Äôs speed, coverage versatility, and pass-rush value, noting that his 29.0% pressure rate ranked second among all off-ball linebackers. While he may not be the most physical run defender, his ability to blitz, cover, and diagnose plays keeps him highly valuable ‚Äî especially in modern defenses.

Coming in at No. 79, edge rusher Al-Quadin Muhammad is projected by Popper to command a two-year, $18 million deal.

Muhammad put together a breakout 2025 season, finishing with 11 sacks, the most among Detroit‚Äôs impending free agents. While he doesn‚Äôt have elite size or athletic traits for an edge defender, his efficiency stands out.

Popper points to Muhammad‚Äôs ability to win late in reps, strong hand usage, and consistent pressure, noting that he ranked 14th in pressure rate among players with at least 250 pass-rush snaps.

That production makes him an ideal situational pass rusher ‚Äî the kind of player teams covet for third-down packages.

Defensive tackle Roy Lopez lands at No. 107 in the rankings, with a projected two-year, $12 million contract.

Lopez isn‚Äôt flashy, but his value lies in doing the dirty work. Popper describes him as a stout, technically sound nose tackle who can hold ground against double teams while still offering some interior push on passing downs.

For a Lions defense that has emphasized toughness and gap integrity up front, Lopez‚Äôs ability to stack blockers and control the interior has been quietly important.

Seeing three Lions defenders ranked by Daniel Popper reinforces just how many tough decisions Detroit may face in the 2026 offseason. Retaining all three won‚Äôt be easy, especially with cap constraints looming, but each player fills a specific role that aligns with Dan Campbell‚Äôs defensive identity.

Whether Brad Holmes chooses to re-sign, replace, or reshuffle these spots, one thing is clear: the rest of the league is paying attention to Detroit‚Äôs talent pipeline ‚Äî and it‚Äôs going to cost real money to keep it intact.

The post 3 Detroit Lions Included in 2026 NFL Free Agency Rankings appeared first on Detroit Sports Nation.

title: Seahawks star DB says NFC title game vs. Rams was 'definitely different'
description: Seahawks DB Nick Emmanwori talked about how big the NFC title game against the Rams felt.
fullText:
At the time, it felt like Rams-Seahawks in the NFC title game was for all the marbles. We knew the winner would face the Patriots in the Super Bowl, and regardless of who represented the NFC, they would‚Äôve been favored against New England.

Seahawks star defensive back Nick Emmanwori admitted the NFC championship felt different. Being a rivalry game, a matchup between arguably the two best teams in football, it carried extra weight.

Here‚Äôs what he said about that marquee matchup on Richard Sherman‚Äôs podcast.

"It was just a different feeling. No disrespect to the Patriots or nothing like that. I don't want to take nothing away from them, but that game ‚Äì¬†that game was, like, legit," he said of the NFC Championship tilt. "You know how it is with the rivalries. The Rams, they come in,¬†Stafford, he's a hell of a quarterback. McVay always got a hell of a plan. That game was definitely different. It was a different type of game. It was live. I was in my zone. I was focused.‚Äù

Like their first two meetings, Rams-Seahawks came down to the wire in the NFC Championship Game. Los Angeles was 6 yards away from a go-ahead touchdown late in the fourth quarter, but couldn‚Äôt punch it in.

On the Seahawks‚Äô ensuing drive, the Rams couldn‚Äôt get the stop they needed on defense, allowing Seattle to milk away most of the clock and burn the Rams‚Äô final timeouts. It lived up to every bit of hype there was entering that game, proving to be a much better matchup than Seahawks-Patriots in the Super Bowl.

This article originally appeared on Rams Wire: Seahawks' Nick Emmanwori says NFC title game vs. Rams was 'different'

title: Winter Olympics: Canada men's hockey team survives OT scare against Czechia
description: Mitch Marner's goal 82 seconds into overtime booked Canada a spot in the semifinals.
fullText:
Mitch Marner saved Canada's men's hockey team from an embarrassing exit at the 2026 Winter Olympics with an overtime goal during a 4-3 win against Czechia on Wednesday.

After a back-and-forth regulation that saw three lead changes and Canada goaltender Jordan Binnington denying Czechia forward Martin Neƒças on a breakaway with 1:12 to play, Marner delivered the winner 82 seconds into the 3-on-3 overtime, beating Luk√°≈° Dost√°l with a backhand.

MITCH MARNER CALLS GAME IN OT. üá®üá¶üí•#WinterOlympics pic.twitter.com/8nCO7eg2fa

‚Äî NBC Olympics & Paralympics (@NBCOlympics) February 18, 2026

Canada now advances to Friday's semifinal where it will face either Sweden ‚Äî should it beat the U.S. on Wednesday ‚Äî or the winner of Finland/Switzerland as the tournament re-seeds following the quarterfinals.

The Czechs put a big scare into Canada and were on the verge of a massive upset. Ond≈ôej Pal√°t's goal with 7:42 to play in the third period put the underdogs ahead 3-2, but minutes later Nick Suzuki saved Canada's hopes with a deflected goal.

WHEN HIS COUNTRY NEEDED HIM MOST, NICK SUZUKI DELIVERED. üá®üá¶ pic.twitter.com/LKLlElEXpK

‚Äî NBC Olympics & Paralympics (@NBCOlympics) February 18, 2026

Team Canada's victory was not without one bit of worrying news. Sidney Crosby was ruled out of the game early in the third period after suffering a lower-body injury.

The 38-year-old, two-time Olympic gold medalist left in the second period after being hit along the boards by Neƒças and Radko Gudas. It was a third big hit Crosby took in the period after Gudas and Pal√°t connected on checks with the Team Canada captain.

Crosby recovered and took a stride following the Gudas and Neƒças hit, but he was seen shaking his right leg before exiting the ice. After being attended to on Canada's bench, Crosby limped down the tunnel to the locker room. He did not return to the bench for the rest of the game.

Czechia was leading 2-1 at the time of Crosby's injury.

title: Konrad Laimer not bothered by stalled negotiations with Bayern Munich
description: FC Bayern could have a tough time in talks with Konrad Laimer.
fullText:
Bayern Munich and Konrad Laimer are reportedly at odds over his contract demands, but the Austrian is not concerned with the process per Sport Bild (as captured by @iMiaSanMia):

Konrad Laimer on reports that contract talks between him and Bayern have stalled: ‚ÄúThere aren‚Äôt many talks taking place at the moment. I‚Äôm still relaxed. You shouldn‚Äôt overthink it.‚Äù

Laimer‚Äôs negotiations are going to be an interesting watch for fans. While no reports have confirmed anything regarding the final numbers in Dayot Upamecano‚Äôs recent contract extension, there are rumors that the Bavarians might have been pushed to their limit ‚Äî and might not be willing to extend themselves much more moving forward.
