title: Ashland's Kennedy Lacey named District 6 Player of the Year
description: Ashland County saw 10 talented girls earn District 6 honors across all divisions.
fullText:
WILLARD - She has been one of the most consistent players around on one of the most consistent teams in the area and District 6 voters recognized that over the weekend.

Ashland junior Kennedy Lacey was named player of the year in Division II/Division III currently averaging 22.5 points, 8.4 rebounds, 2.0 assists, 3.1 steals, 0.5 blocks per game entering the postseason.

Senior Camryn Cox (9.2 points, 8.2 rebounds, 1.8 assists, 2.6 steals, 1.8 blocks) earned first team honors as well, classmate Madison Hoffman (14.1 points, 3.8 rebounds, 2.5 assists, 1.8 steals) and junior Cienna Steury (7.8 points, 2.1 rebounds, 1.9 assists, 1.7 steals) landed on the second team.

Renee Holt was named coach of the year after leading the Lady Arrows to back-to-back Ohio Cardinal Conference titles going undefeated in league play for the first time.

In Division VI, seniors Valery Henry of New London (11.9 points, 5.2 rebounds, 2.0 assists, 1.3 steals) and Tori Kidney of Crestview (12.3 points, 4.8 rebounds, 2.6 assists, 2.8 steals) were selected to the first team. Second teamers include New London seniors Raeann Mitchell (7.0 points, 3.6 rebounds, 4.2 assists, 2.0 steals) and Gracie Thomas (9.7 points, 8.5 rebounds, 1.3 assists, 1.1 steals) along with South Central senior Emily Lamoreaux (9.5 points). And Crestview sophomore Shelby Bays (7.3 points, 4.6 rebounds, 2.2 assists, 3.2 steals, 1.3 blocks) was an honorable mention.

title: San Diego State stumbles down stretch, Grand Canyon completes series sweep
description: Viejas Arena has had its share of moments over the years where the San Diego State Aztecs have unnerved their opponents down the stretch.On Tuesday night, uncharacteristically it was the Aztecs who at times appeared sped up in the second half, as the Grand Canyon Lopes took advantage of four turnovers over the final six-and-a-half minutes and salted the season series with a 73-63 win on Tuesday night.Miles Byrd led SDSU (18-7, 12-3 Mountain West) with 18 points, scoring 13 in the second stanza,
fullText:
SAN DIEGO ‚Äì Viejas Arena has had its share of moments over the years where the San Diego State Aztecs have unnerved their opponents down the stretch.

On Tuesday night, uncharacteristically it was the Aztecs who at times appeared sped up in the second half, as the Grand Canyon Lopes took advantage of four turnovers over the final six-and-a-half minutes and salted the season series with a 73-63 win on Tuesday night.

Miles Byrd led SDSU (18-7, 12-3 Mountain West) with 18 points, scoring 13 in the second stanza, but the hosts shot just 31.3% from the field in the final 20 minutes, including making 2 of 13 over a nine-minute stretch where Grand Canyon (17-9, 10-5) took control.

Jaden Henley scored a game-high 21 points with three steals, while Efe Demirel added 14 points with 11 rebounds and Makiah Williams scored 11 points with seven rebounds and three assists.

A top of the key 3-pointer by Byrd 86 seconds into the second half was the last time the Aztecs held the lead, as GCU responded with an 8-0 run to take the lead. The closest SDSU was able to pull the rest of the way came on Byrd scoring an and-one to make it 43-41 GCU with just over five minutes played.

But Williams responded with a 3-pointer and Dennis Evans scored a second-chance bucket by hooking a rebound home. Grand Canyon had a 22-12 edge in paint scoring for the second half, part of a 30-26 advantage for the game.

Trailing by 12-points with 8:21 remaining, the final SDSU kick saw the Scarlet and Black pull within 5-points twice, with Tae Simmons making a pair of free-throws after getting fouled in transition with 4:29 to play, then Byrd making a pair of at the line with 1:49 to play.

Simmons finished with 9 points and four rebounds, while Taj DeGourville had 8 points in 22 minutes off the bench ‚Äî he and Byrd were the only Aztecs to make three or more from the field.

GCU closed the game out by scoring 7 of the final 9 points for the game. The Lopes have won six of the seven games all-time against the Aztecs, including winning two of three contests on The Mesa.

The opening half started out like a slug-fest, with both teams taking away clear paths to the basket and forcing jump shots. With the Lopes hitting from downtown out of the game, knocking down three of their first six attempts, the visitors were able to build a 9-point lead when Nana¬†Owusu-Anane hit from the left wing with just over ten minutes played.

SDSU struggled getting the ball inside early, unable to get through the length of the Lopes defenders until Pharaoh¬†Compton scored the Scarlet and Black‚Äôs first paint bucket on a dip-under layup. Miles¬†Heide scored 5 points in a row for the Aztecs, getting a dunk and then drawing an and-one.

But the mood began to change after a layup by Henley when Byrd hit SDSU‚Äôs first and only triple of the first half at the 7:15 mark, and then knocked the ball free and BJ Davis converted one of two at the line after getting fouled that made it a 4-point deficit.

After the Lopes had not missed more than two consecutive shots through the first 11-plus minutes, SDSU limited the visitors to just 1-for-8 shooting down the stretch to turn the game around while putting together a 14-3 scoring run heading into the break.

Byrd started it with a fading jumper on the left side of the lane off an in-bounds play, then an SDSU steal led to a Sean¬†Newman Jr. layup. The Aztecs pulled within 1-point when Simmons shook free down low for a slam.

The only GCU respite was another Owusu-Anane triple, but SDSU scored the final 8 points of the half with DeGourville and Simmons both converting a pair at the line. Then the sophomore guard alley-ooped to Simmons with 75 seconds before halftime that turned Viejas all the way up to ‚Äòmadhouse‚Äô status. DeGourville added another transition bucket after a steal, then Byrd forced a 30-second shot clock violation on the Lopes final possession as SDSU led 33-29 at the break.

SDSU fell half-a-game back of Utah State for first place in the conference, with the Aggies hosting Boise State on Wednesday night.

The Aztecs will head out to Moby Arena to face the Colorado State Rams, who the Scarlet and Black beat 73-50 on Jan. 28. Tip-off from Fort Collins is scheduled for 3 p.m. PT on Saturday, Feb. 21, with televised coverage on CBS Sports Network and a local radio broadcast on 760 AM.

title: Boston Red Sox trade idea finally moves on from Triston Casas after two years of rumors
description: Boston can finally move off Casas.
fullText:
Boston Red Sox trade idea finally moves on from Triston Casas after two years of rumors originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Boston Red Sox are getting rolling down in Florida for Spring Training, but it hasn't stopped many from suggesting that they still need to improve.

The Red Sox have done what they've needed to do throughout the offseason, adding multiple bats, including Willson Contreras, who can play first base, but it might not be the worst idea to get rid of Triston Casas to address other areas of need while playing Contreras at first.

In a trade proposal from Ryan Shea of Sports Illustrated, Boston would trade Casas to the Washington Nationals in exchange for two arms.

Red Sox receive: Travis Sykora, Jackson Kent

‚ÄúThe Red Sox would target Nationals pitchers Travis Sykora and Jackson Kent to bolster their pitching depth and add high-upside arms to their farm system,‚Äù he wrote.

‚ÄúWith the offseason signing of Wilson Contreras securing first base, Triston Casas becomes expendable, especially given his history of injuries that have limited his availability and production.‚Äù

Contreras was clearly added to replace Casas, at least for right now, but it's also important to remember that at points throughout Casas‚Äô career, he's been a decent player. While he's coming off a tough injury and didn't play well prior to that, it's also tough to give up on a player as young as he is.

However, many seem to want to trade him, so I doubt anyone would be upset about the decision to do so if it were to happen.

title: New York Yankees trade proposal sends Anthony Volpe to lousy NL team for 25-year-old All-Star shortstop
description: The Yankees could finally dump Volpe.
fullText:
New York Yankees trade proposal sends Anthony Volpe to lousy NL team for 25-year-old All-Star shortstop originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The shortstop position is one of the top talking points surrounding the New York Yankees, as Anthony Volpe hasn‚Äôt been great. One proposed deal looks to address the position with a major shake-up.

In a mock deal from Thomas Carelli of Sports Illustrated, New York would land infielder CJ Abrams from the Washington Nationals in a swap centered on both MLB talents and prospect capital.

Nationals receive: Volpe, Bryce Cunningham, Prospect to be named

‚ÄúYankees fans are absolutely fed up with Volpe. As for now, Jose Caballero is the listed starting shortstop. This is due to Volpe's injury, but still, not great,‚Äù Carelli wrote.

From an offensive standpoint, Abrams is a lot better of a player than Volpe, but to say that he doesn't have his issues on both sides of the baseball would be a bit unfair, as he's good but not great.

Carelli did acknowledge Volpe‚Äôs defensive value, but questioned his long-term position of staying in the Bronx. With Volpe set to start the season on the IR due to offseason shoulder surgery, there's a possibility that if Jose Caballero plays well enough, he won't have a place to play on this team.

‚ÄúVolpe can still be good ‚Äî he was a Gold Glove. However, his time in New York is nearly over.‚Äù

It's unfortunate that it's gotten to this point, but if the Yankees are serious about winning, it might be better to do it now than in the future.

title: Luka Doncic supported Lakers' cautious trade deadline approach
description: The Lakers didn't make a major trade this season, but Luka Doncic was reportedly supportive of the team's plan to be cautious on the trade market.
fullText:
For many Los Angeles Lakers fans, the period leading up to the NBA's Feb. 5 trade deadline was a disappointing one. The Lakers made one minor trade in which they acquired sharpshooter Luke Kennard, and they reportedly stubbornly refused to acquire anyone who had a contract past this season in order to maintain maximum salary cap flexibility this summer.

They're projected to have roughly $50 million of cap space this offseason, which means they could make at least one significant move and also go down one of several different pathways. Therefore, the opportunity is there for them to truly shape their roster around Luka Doncic and become championship contenders.

According to Dave McMenamin of ESPN, Doncic supported L.A.'s cautious approach prior to the trade deadline, even though it yielded little in the way of help for a team that is playoff-caliber but not championship-caliber.

"A source familiar with Doncic's thinking told ESPN that L.A.'s deadline approach with 'adherence to discipline' and focus on the 'long-term picture' was supported by the 26-year-old star."

At the same time, Doncic reportedly hasn't pushed for the team to go after another true superstar such as the Milwaukee Bucks' Giannis Antetokounmpo.

"He has not pushed the team to add a superstar-level co-star for when James is no longer on the roster."

In addition to their substantial cap space, the Lakers will be able to offer two future first-round draft picks, as well as the rights to their 2026 first-rounder, in potential trades this summer. Whether they go all-in on Antetokounmpo or instead pursue a couple of non-stars who will move the needle, this offseason will be the most important one they have had in a while, and it could set the tone for what will transpire over at least the next few seasons.

This article originally appeared on LeBron Wire: Luka Doncic supported Lakers' cautious trade deadline approach

title: Philadelphia Phillies almost got bailed out of Nick Castellanos situation by historic team in American League
description: Philly was so close to dodging this bullet.
fullText:
Philadelphia Phillies almost got bailed out of Nick Castellanos situation by historic team in American League originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Moving on from Nick Castellanos didn‚Äôt come with much relief for the Philadelphia Phillies financially, especially considering there was at least some level of outside interest before the team decided to eat the $20 million remaining on his contract.

According to Dylan Svoboda of the New York Post, the New York Yankees considered the possibility of trading for the veteran slugger earlier in the offseason, a scenario that could have helped Philadelphia offload salary while recouping value.

‚ÄúThe Yankees were talked out of pursuing Nick Castellanos,‚Äù Svoboda reported.

‚ÄúThe team looked into trading for the Phillies slugger earlier this offseason, but backed off after receiving mixed reviews, according to The Post‚Äôs Jon Heyman.‚Äù

Instead of pursuing Castellanos, New York opted for a different roster fit.

‚ÄúInstead, the Yankees brought back Paul Goldschmidt, who will serve as a right-handed bat off the bench and spell the lefty-swinging Ben Rice at first base.‚Äù

Had the Yankees gone that route, the Phillies may have found an easier and kinder exit from Castellanos‚Äô contract. Instead, Philadelphia moved on without worrying about what financial troubles it had to deal with, while the outfielder eventually landed with the San Diego Padres in free agency.

Castellanos was seen getting some work in as a first baseman after signing with the Padres. Perhaps a position change can help him get back to form offensively.

title: Everything Tom Izzo said after Michigan State dominated UCLA
description: See what Tom Izzo had to say in his post-game press conference after Michigan State dismantled UCLA.
fullText:
Michigan State basketball welcomed in UCLA on Tuesday night, looking to bounce back from an embarrassing loss to Wisconsin this past Friday. The Spartans answered the bell, dominating the Bruins en route to a 82-59 victory.

Following the win, head coach Tom Izzo spoke with the media, this is what he had to say:

"My sport is harder than yours," he says, pointing at Steve Mariucci

"I guess Mick Cronin upgraded that to a flagrant two, huh? That's the first time I've saw a coach do that. He'll get that straightened out."

"Denham Wojcik hurt his shoulder a bit, that is why he did not play in the second half."

"I thought Jeremy Fears Jr. might've played one of his best games. He played so under control, he didn't take bad shots. I am still waiting for him to take over the team when they switch defenses. I am still asking that of him."

"Hey, we played better, but that wasn't the UCLA team we saw on film."

"I told my team, its about a choice you want to make, it's about an attitude. These swings (in conference play) are enormous."

"I'm not ready to give Jordan Scott that position (point guard) quite yet. But I liked it, he's been phenomenal. He's so unentitled. There is no entitlement in Jordan Scott."

"Jordan Scott has a sense of urgency and purpose that is far beyond his years."

"We think the guy that can take two more steps is Coen Carr. He can step, he can slash, he is so athletic. Making more shots, he has worked so hard at that this year."

"We did some really good things, we did some bone-headed things, we need to clean up the bone-headed things, do more of the really good things."

"I brought in Kur, Denham, those five guys. I said Kur and Cam Ward , we need them to step up three steps. We get Cam going a little more each day, he gives us a dimension that the other bigs don't have, with that athleticism."

"At the end, I thought our fans and the student section did a great job. When a guy comes back, they can be real jerks. I thought he (Booker) didn't deserve that. Give him credit, give our fans credit."

Contact/Follow us¬†@The SpartansWire¬†on X (formerly Twitter) and like our page on¬†Facebook¬†to follow ongoing coverage of Michigan State news, notes and opinion. You can also follow Cory Linsner on X¬†@Rex_Linzy

This article originally appeared on Spartans Wire: Everything Tom Izzo said after Michigan State dominated UCLA

title: New York Yankees almost made a $20 million mistake but decided to sign Paul Goldschmidt instead
description: Yankees fans should be relieved they got Goldy back instead of making this move.
fullText:
New York Yankees almost made a $20 million mistake but decided to sign Paul Goldschmidt instead originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Before he ultimately changed teams, New York Yankees decision-makers did their homework on a former All-Star, who most fans wouldn‚Äôt have wanted.

According to Dylan Svoboda of the New York Post, New York explored the possibility of acquiring veteran slugger Nick Castellanos from the Philadelphia Phillies earlier in the offseason before he was released and later signed by the San Diego Padres.

The interest, however, never became much.

‚ÄúThe Yankees were talked out of pursuing Nick Castellanos,‚Äù Svoboda wrote.

‚ÄúThe team looked into trading for the Phillies slugger earlier this offseason, but backed off after receiving mixed reviews, according to The Post‚Äôs Jon Heyman.‚Äù

Ultimately, New York went with a familiar option in Paul Goldschmidt. While Goldschmidt isn‚Äôt what he once was at this stage of his career, neither is Castellanos, and Goldschmidt doesn‚Äôt come with the attitude that the former Phillies outfielder does.

While Castellanos‚Äô power profile may have intrigued the Yankees on paper, there‚Äôs not much to say about him at this stage of his career. He also wasn‚Äôt content with his role and that‚Äôs something the Yankees shouldn‚Äôt have wanted to deal with.

"A lot of times when a good player has their role change with the club, it can cause some friction, and his role changed last year from where it was," Dave Dombrowski said. "I mean you played every single day for a lot years in a row, and so sometimes that can contribute to it. Sometimes then people have debates between themselves where they're not all on the same page. But when you put all that together, sometimes you just need to make sure that you have a change of scenery."

title: UCLA HC Mick Cronin comments on MSU student section in heated exchange
description: In a heated exchange with the media, UCLA head coach Mick Cronin commented on the Izzone following MSU's win on Tuesday night.
fullText:
Michigan State demolished UCLA on Tuesday night, dismantling the Bruins, 82-59. The win was a massive bounce back spot for the Spartans, who fell to Wisconsin this past Friday night.

Following the game, Bruins head coach Mick Cronin did not hold a formal press conference, but did give the media a small availability outside of his locker room. In that availability, he was asked a question about the MSU student section, but he was very combative in his answer.

Using some expletives in between, Cronin shared that he did not care about the Izzone, and was more worried about his team himself. This was in a semi-heated exchange with the media.

Watch what he had to say via X:

UCLA coach Mick Cronin's thoughts on the Michigan State student section. @ThisistheIZZONE pic.twitter.com/7pJJHEs7sQ

title: New York Yankees get excellent injury news on Giancarlo Stanton as Spring Training gets underway
description: Yankees fans will be pleased.
fullText:
New York Yankees get excellent injury news on Giancarlo Stanton as Spring Training gets underway originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Spring Training check-ins are underway across camp, and New York Yankees manager Aaron Boone offered an encouraging early update on slugger Giancarlo Stanton.

Speaking with reporters, including Randy Miller of NJ.com, Boone had very promising words to say about Stanton, who has dealt with many injuries throughout his time in the Bronx.

‚ÄúI think he‚Äôs doing great,‚Äù Boone said of Stanton. ‚ÄúI haven‚Äôt seen him yet. He‚Äôs one of the guys that will get here. But he‚Äôs had a good winter. He‚Äôs ready to roll.‚Äù

Stanton‚Äôs health has been a recurring storyline in recent seasons, making any positive offseason news a good thing as the Yankees prepare for the regular season.

Boone also made it clear that, even with Stanton feeling well, the team will stick to its usual approach early in camp and try not to overdo it.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt expect any limitations. I usually slow-play him into games in spring, so you might not see him that first week.‚Äù

That ramp-up stuff has been normal for Stanton, as it allows him to build himself up without getting hurt doing something that‚Äôs ultimately useless.

If the early outlook continues on, the Yankees could enter the season with one of their top power bats fully available, a key factor for a lineup looking to not only score a lot of runs, but also hit home runs and win the American League.

title: Mail: Man Utd ‚Äòtrying to negotiate‚Äô financial terms with player who turned down AC Milan to play at Old Trafford this year
description: Manchester United remain in ongoing talks with Harry Maguire to try to hash out an agreement for a new contract.As things stand, the centre-half will pull the curtains on his Red Devils career in June...
fullText:
Manchester United remain in ongoing talks with Harry Maguire to try to hash out an agreement for a new contract.

As things stand, the centre-half will pull the curtains on his Red Devils career in June unless a deal is signed.

MailSport claims that United are ‚Äòtrying to negotiate‚Äô a reduction in his ¬£180,000-a-week wages in order to make the financial terms more suitable for them.

DOWNLOAD THE OFFICIAL STRETTY NEWS APP FOR ALL THE LATEST UPDATES & BREAKING ‚Äì STRAIGHT TO YOUR PHONE! ON APPLE & GOOGLE PLAY

(Photo by Carl Recine/Getty Images)

In the meantime, Maguire actually rebuffed a mid-season approach from AC Milan last month, making it clear that his desire was to stay at Old Trafford and extend his stay beyond the seven-year mark.

He has enjoyed a prominent role under Michael Carrick thus far, having started every game since the former Red took the reins.

The impending return of Matthijs de Ligt following his lengthy injury layoff does prompt uncertainty over who will partner Lisandro Martinez until May ‚Äì though if Carrick‚Äôs early management showings are anything to go by, he operates with a philosophy of ‚Äòif it isn‚Äôt broke, don‚Äôt fix it‚Äô.

Carrick has made only one change to his starting XI thus far, and it‚Äôs one he was forced into after Patrick Dorgu suffered a hamstring problem in the win over Arsenal.

While Martinez and Maguire are putting in such stalwart shifts at the back, it isn‚Äôt worth intervening and potentially messing up such a dynamic pairing.

(Photo by Alex Livesey/Getty Images)

United‚Äôs No.5 isn‚Äôt the only one who‚Äôs out of contract this summer, either.

Casemiro has already confirmed that he‚Äôll be bidding farewell to the club in June ‚Äì much to fans‚Äô dismay.

Tom Heaton is expected to be offered another short-term deal; even though he hasn‚Äôt played in a competitive match since February 2023, the hierarchy believes it‚Äôs worth keeping him amongst the squad for his influence on the younger players and goalkeeping unit.

Jadon Sancho, currently on loan with Aston Villa, and Tyrell Malacia will be departing as free agents.

title: Shedeur Sanders gets interesting Cleveland Browns update after team decided to hire Todd Monken
description: What does the future hold for Shedeur in Cleveland?
fullText:
Shedeur Sanders gets interesting Cleveland Browns update after team decided to hire Todd Monken originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Quarterback development will be the talk of the offseason for the Cleveland Browns under new head coach Todd Monken, especially with all of the options the Browns can go with. The Browns had multiple quarterbacks under center a year ago, and none of them did the job.

Daniel Oyefusi of ESPN highlighted how Shedeur Sanders will factor into Cleveland‚Äôs offensive future, even if his rookie season didn‚Äôt go as planned.

Even with the organization evaluating the position in the draft, Monken‚Äôs hiring was tied in part to his impressive quarterback history.

‚ÄúEven as general manager Andrew Berry had said that Cleveland would explore its quarterback options this offseason, part of Monken's appeal was his ability to work with the team's current group of quarterbacks ‚Äì Sanders, Deshaun Watson and Dillon Gabriel ‚Äì and meld his scheme to their differing skill sets,‚Äù Oyefusi wrote.

For Sanders, this should offer him an opportunity to develop in a system fixed to maximize his strengths rather than dealing with what he had to do last year. It‚Äôs also important to bring up the fact that Cleveland needs more talent around any option, so that needs to be a priority this summer.

Sanders was OK at times in his rookie season, but far from good. He has a lot to learn and will have an easier time doing so if he can get up to speed and have a better coach.

title: Luiz Diaz happy that he joined Bayern Munich instead of Florian Wirtz
description: And so is every FC Bayern fan around the world.
fullText:
Bayern Munich‚Äôs star signing of the summer has delivered BIG TIME.

Luis D√≠az continues to dazzle Bayern Munich fans with his incredible combination of speed, footwork, intensity, and an engine for days. His relentless pressing, combined with his defensive work and elite positioning, also makes him one of the most complete wingers in football. Bayern acquired the signing of the season so far from Liverpool, a club that ended up signing Bayern‚Äôs long-term transfer target Florian Wirtz.

Funny how things play out sometimes.

In a Sky Germany interview with Kerry Hau (as captured by @iMiaSanMia), Diaz surmised things worked out the way they did for a reason.

‚ÄúThere must have been reasons why Florian didn‚Äôt come here in the end. Now I‚Äôm here, and thank God things turned out this way. I‚Äôm very happy and grateful,‚Äù D√≠az said.

D√≠az has 19 goals and 15 assists across all competitions for Bayern Munich this season. And we are in February. Florian Wirtz, a superb player in his own right, has six goals and eight assists across all competitions for Liverpool.

title: Napoli‚Äôs Mazzocchi: ‚ÄúScoring against Roma was hard. We gave it our all.‚Äù
description: In an interview with Radio CRC, Pasquale Mazzocchi returned to the topic of the last league match between Napoli and Roma, which ended 2-2. The Italian winger came on in the final minutes of the game,...
fullText:
In an interview with Radio CRC, Pasquale Mazzocchi returned to the topic of the last league match between Napoli and Roma, which ended 2-2.

The Italian winger came on in the final minutes of the game, immediately after the goal that leveled the scoreline.

The former Salernitana player highlighted the high intensity of the match: ‚ÄúIn Napoli-Roma, I don‚Äôt think we lacked anything; it was a very physical match with many challenges won by both sides.‚Äù

‚ÄúIn my opinion, they played some parts of the game better than us, but I think that with all the difficulties we‚Äôre facing, we showed that we‚Äôre fighting tooth and nail to at least get a draw.‚Äù

In his speech, Mazzocchi then drew a comparison with last season: ‚ÄúLast year, we won the league with the best defense, so it‚Äôs important to point out that Roma have this characteristic today. When you face teams with a solid and strong defense, it‚Äôs difficult to score against them.‚Äù

Finally, the winger emphasized the coaching staff‚Äôs contribution to managing the match: ‚ÄúBut the coach did well to find the equalizer with his substitutions.‚Äù

title: Cole Palmer spotted in Dubai nightclub with Chelsea teammates after FA Cup absence
description: Cole Palmer was not included in Chelsea‚Äôs squad for their 4-0 FA Cup win over Hull City on Friday night. Even though it was a comfortable victory, it still left some supporters wondering about his absence.
fullText:
Cole Palmer was not included in Chelsea‚Äôs squad for their 4-0 FA Cup win over Hull City on Friday night.

Even though it was a comfortable victory, it still left some supporters wondering about his absence.

The Blues rotated heavily for the tie and progressed without difficulty, but attention soon shifted away from the pitch.

Clips began circulating on social media over the weekend showing Palmer in a Dubai nightclub alongside teammates Joao Pedro and Marc Cucurella.

The timing of the appearance quickly sparked conversation, given Chelsea‚Äôs ongoing domestic schedule and looming Premier League fixture.

Footage showed Palmer enjoying a night out in Dubai with Pedro and Cucurella.

Palmer had not been named in the matchday squad against Hull, while Pedro was included but remained an unused substitute during the 4-0 win.

Cucurella‚Äôs absence was injury-related, with the Spanish defender currently sidelined by a hamstring issue.

There has been no suggestion of disciplinary action, as the outing appeared to take place during scheduled downtime.

Still, the visuals prompted reaction online, particularly given Palmer‚Äôs importance to Chelsea‚Äôs attack.

Chelsea return to Premier League action against Burnley on Saturday, a match that could see Palmer and Pedro both restored to the starting lineup.

Palmer is one of the club‚Äôs most influential attacking players and would be expected to feature if fully available.

Pedro is also in contention to start after being unused in the FA Cup tie. Cucurella, however, will miss out due to his hamstring injury.

With league points at stake, focus now shifts back to the pitch as Chelsea prepare for the weekend fixture.

title: Excitement at Liverpool as teenager makes 'massive' development; now on brink of first-team
description: Kieran Morrison shinesKieran Morrison was on the bench against Brighton at the weekend but unfortunately didn't get on. He did get a start for the Under 21s on Sunday, though, and that was a chance he...
fullText:
Kieran Morrison was on the bench against Brighton at the weekend but unfortunately didn't get on. He did get a start for the Under 21s on Sunday, though, and that was a chance he took.

In fact, Morrison was captain of the team in Amad Nallo's absence. He oversaw a 4-3 win against West Bromwich Albion, with the midfielder getting the winner.

That continues a brilliant run of form from Morrison. He's got six goals and an assist in his last five Under 21 appearances, two of which came as captain. Three of those goals proved to be winners, too.

Manager Rob Page certainly sees Morrison getting better and better, saying the development has been clear over the last six months.

title: Mbappe: Prestianni called Vinicius a monkey five times, he should never play in the Champions League again
description: Real Madrid duo Vinicius Jr and Kylian Mbappe have accused Benfica star Gianluca Prestianni of racism towards the former during their UEFA Champions League clash.Mbappe said (via Teledeporte), ‚ÄúPres...
fullText:
Real Madrid duo Vinicius Jr and Kylian Mbappe have accused Benfica star Gianluca Prestianni of racism towards the former during their UEFA Champions League clash.

Mbappe said (via Teledeporte), ‚ÄúPrestianni clearly called Vini Jr a monkey, it happened five times‚Äù.

‚ÄúI saw that. UEFA have the best cameras, now we wait. This is not acceptable. It‚Äôs not my kind of human being.‚Äù

He continued, ‚ÄúBenfica are a top club, nothing against them, but Prestianni should never play in the Champions League anymore.‚Äù

Los Blancos went to Benfica for the first leg of their play-off, hoping to book a place in the round of 16.

Vinicius gave Real Madrid the lead just after the half-time break, curling in a fantastic strike followed by an exuberant celebration.

The referee Francois Letexier brandished a yellow card for Vinicius as Prestianni ran towards the Brazilian, pulling his shirt up over his mouth before saying something to the Madrid striker.

An incensed Vinicius then approached the referee, who crossed his arms in front of his face, triggering FIFA‚Äôs anti-racism protocol and halting the match temporarily.

Benfica coach Jose Mourinho¬†then tried to console the winger, but he wasn‚Äôt having it. He left the field for a while.

A member of the Benfica coaching staff received a red card during that incident, and Mourinho would pick up one for a separate incident.

Vinicius eventually returned to the pitch after 10 minutes, although that didn‚Äôt stop the booing and object-throwing.

The 2024 Ballon d‚ÄôOr runner-up took to his Instagram to call the fans cowards while Mourinho rumbled on about him needing to be more respectful with his celebrations. This from Mourinho?

In addition to the racism issue, Mourinho also accused the referee of holding a note stating that Real Madrid players at risk of missing the second leg could not be shown a card.

The incidents overshadowed a terrific, pulsating game of football, set perfectly after their group-stage encounter.

title: Braves' Alex Anthopoulos blasted for letting $22M Cy Young arm go amid Spencer Schwellenbach injury
description: The Braves might be in the same place they were last season before Spring Training games even start.
fullText:
Braves' Alex Anthopoulos blasted for letting $22M Cy Young arm go amid Spencer Schwellenbach injury originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Atlanta Braves are hoping for a bounce-back season after a disappointing 2025 campaign. However, injuries are already beginning to pile up in the starting rotation, mirroring what plagued the team last year. The domino effect began when it was announced that starter Spencer Schwellenbach was injured.

‚ÄúThe Braves opened camp this morning with an unwelcome update on talented young righty Spencer Schwellenbach. He‚Äôs been placed on the 60-day injured list due to inflammation in his right elbow, per Mark Bowman of MLB.com. The team‚Äôs hope is that the 25-year-old is dealing with bone spurs and not something more nefarious,‚Äù MLB Trade Rumors‚Äô Steve Adams wrote.

Still, there were arms on the market for Braves GM Alex Anthopoulos to pursue. One notable option was Zac Gallen, but he ultimately re-signed with the Arizona Diamondbacks.

‚ÄúZac Gallen returns to the Diamondbacks on a 1-year, $22.025 million contract with $14 million deferred after market craters,‚Äù Bob Nightengale wrote.

FanSided‚Äôs Zachary Rotman believes Atlanta letting Gallen walk is a major reason why the Braves can‚Äôt be taken seriously as a contender in 2026.

‚ÄúThe durability concerns with Atlanta's rotation are impossible to ignore, and while the team has some depth, it's clear the Braves need more than they have. Gallen was the last really interesting starter left on the free agency market. Perhaps the Braves will pivot to a guy like Lucas Giolito who won't cost as much money and won't require the forfiture of any draft capital, but until they actually add meaningful starting pitching depth, it's easy to criticize Alex Anthopoulos for not taking advantage of a suppressed Gallen market,‚Äù Rotman wrote.

Letting Gallen walk in free agency without putting up much of a fight doesn‚Äôt make a lot of sense when evaluating the Braves‚Äô roster. Atlanta addressed most of its needs this winter ‚Äî except starting pitching.

If the Braves get off to a slow start because of their rotation, it will be easy to point the finger at allowing a player like Gallen to leave. At the end of the day, it‚Äôs difficult to justify not aggressively pursuing a promising arm given the team‚Äôs current situation.

title: Newcastle predicted XI vs Qarabag: In-form Gordon and Barnes look to take down vulnerable Azerbaijani champions (4-3-3)
description: Newcastle United aim to take a major step towards the round of 16 when they travel to face Qarabag in the first leg of their Champions League knockout phase play-off tonight.The Magpies arrive in conf...
fullText:
Newcastle United aim to take a major step towards the round of 16 when they travel to face Qarabag in the first leg of their Champions League knockout phase play-off tonight.

The Magpies arrive in confident mood following an impressive domestic cup victory, but face a Qarabag side enjoying their best-ever European campaign.

While Newcastle are favourites to reach the last 16, the Azerbaijani champions are eager to continue their remarkable journey, setting up a high-stakes European encounter.

Newcastle head into the clash boosted by their recent 3-1 comeback victory over Aston Villa in the FA Cup, with Sandro Tonali delivering a standout display with two goals.

That victory continued a promising run of results for Eddie Howe‚Äôs side as they attempt to balance domestic and European ambitions.

The Magpies finished 12th in the Champions League league phase to reach the play-offs. Only Arsenal FC conceded fewer goals during that stage of the competition.

Newcastle‚Äôs attacking threat has largely come from wide areas, with Anthony Gordon and Harvey Barnes playing pivotal roles.

The duo have combined for 70% of the club‚Äôs goals in the competition and will again be key figures in breaking down Qarabag‚Äôs defence.

Meanwhile, Qarabag have already made history by becoming the first Azerbaijani club to reach this stage of the Champions League.

Despite a heavy defeat to Liverpool during the league phase, they produced impressive results earlier in the campaign and have been dangerous on home soil.

The hosts rely heavily on forward Camilo Duran, who has scored four goals in the competition and remains central to their attacking strategy.

This will be Newcastle‚Äôs longest-ever away journey in European competition, travelling over 2,500 miles to face Qarabag.

Qarabag have conceded 21 goals in the competition, one of the highest totals among teams still in the competition.

The Geordies will back themselves to score against the home side.

Newcastle have lost just one of their last six European fixtures, while Qarabag have won just one of their last six European matches but boast a strong home scoring record.

Howe faces several injury concerns heading into the fixture, with midfield lynchpin Bruno Guimaraes sidelined with a hamstring problem.

Defenders Tino Livramento and Fabian Schar are also unavailable, while Joelinton, Lewis Miley and Yoane Wissa will be assessed ahead of kick-off.

‚ÄòOutstanding goalkeeper‚Äô Nick Pope is expected replace Aaron Ramsdale and start between the posts.

title: BYU continues slide in home loss to Cincinnati
description: The Cougars have been nearly unbeatable at home this season, but the Bearcats figured them out on Tuesday.
fullText:
Cincinnati handed BYU just their third home loss of the season Tuesday night at the

Marriott Center, topping the Cougars 76-67 in a game that was closer than the final score

indicated. The Bearcats shot-making in the final moments of the game did BYU in, the visitors

outscoring the Provo school 14-2 to close out the game.

‚ÄúWe talked a lot to our team about how well BYU plays at home,‚Äù Cincinnati coach

Katrina Merriweather said after her team‚Äôs win. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm really proud of our players. I thought we

weathered some runs and some storms there where we weren‚Äôt playing great. And just to see

them pull this win out, when road wins have been really hard for us to come by, was really

Cincinnati entered Provo having lost four of its last five games and with only one Big 12

road win to its name. BYU hadn‚Äôt had much better success of late, having lost three of its last

four contests and sliding into 11th place in the conference.

‚ÄúThere‚Äôs a clear recipe out there against us right now,‚Äù BYU coach Lee Cummard said.

‚ÄúDrive us, rebound against us, and try to speed (us) up and force turnovers. And that kind of just leads to a good recipe for the other team and not so much for us and that‚Äôs what happened today.‚Äù

The Cougars gave up 20 offensive rebounds on the night, despite their best efforts to

make that a focus coming into the contest.

‚ÄúRebounding was number one on our game plan ‚Ä¶ as we came into this game,‚Äù

Cummard said. ‚ÄúTo give up 20 offensive rebounds, we got to just own it. Credit to them.‚Äù

Turnovers, too, have been a common denominator in the Cougars‚Äô struggles, giving up the

ball 19 times in each of its last three losses.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a thing that‚Äôs really kind of hindered us most of the season that we have to improve

on,‚Äù Cummard said. ‚ÄúWe just got to grow from it.‚Äù

The Bearcats, on the other hand, showed few signs of struggle at the

beginning of the game, scoring 26 of their 29 first-quarter points in the initial 6:26 and putting

BYU in a deficit of 11. The Cougars responded, scoring 10 points in less than two minutes

to cut the score to four by the quarter‚Äôs end.

Both teams cooled off a bit in the second quarter, both scoring just 11 points in the period

after their initial offensive outburst.

The Cougars tied the game by the end of the third, going into the final 10 minutes

BYU took a 62-65 lead on a made 3-pointer from sophomore guard Delaney Gibb

with 4:07 left in the game before Cincinnati slammed the door shut, outscoring the Cougars by

The Bearcats‚Äô run was ignited by a made three to tie the score from senior guard Mya

Perry, who finished the night with a game-high 32 points.

‚ÄúNo surprise that Mya Perry showed up big time for us,‚Äù Merriweather said. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve seen

her do some incredible things. She‚Äôs a big-time shot maker. ‚Ä¶ I think she‚Äôs one of the best

offensive guards in the country.‚Äù

BYU learned that the hard way. Cincinnati, meanwhile, couldn‚Äôt have enjoyed their trip to

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre staying in a great place,‚Äù Merriweather said. ‚ÄúThe kids are looking at mountains. I

mean ‚Ä¶ they probably felt like they were on a little bit of a vacation. ‚Ä¶ So sometimes things

just roll your way and I feel like that played a big part into what happened tonight.‚Äù

BYU will try to get things rolling back its way in a road matchup against Utah Saturday.

The Cougars and the Utes met in Provo earlier this year, with the home squad earning a 12-point

win. Saturday‚Äôs contest will begin at 2:00 p.m.

title: Wales' Hawkins ready to mix it with Scottish Lions
description: Wales centre Joe Hawkins ready to go toe-to-toe with Scotland's Lions in the Six Nations at Principality Stadium.
fullText:
When Joe Hawkins agreed to return to Wales last summer it was for moments like this coming Saturday, when he could lock horns with a trio of Scottish Lions at Principality Stadium.

The 23-year-old Scarlets centre won his eighth cap in Sunday's defeat by France in Cardiff.

It was Hawkins' first Six Nations appearance since the 2023 win against Italy in Rome, the last time Wales enjoyed a victory in the championship.

The centre moved from Ospreys to Exeter at the end of that season and fell victim of the Welsh Rugby Union's cap selection policy.

"A big part in me coming back to Wales was to try and be part of the Welsh squad and to play in competitions like this," said Hawkins, who missed the 2023 World Cup after his move to the Chiefs.

"I don't think there is a better international competition than the Six Nations. It's amazing being back involved."

Wales 'can't cut corners' in losing streak - Wilson

Wales to face Fiji at Cardiff City Stadium

Tandy 'needs help' - Wales' hunt for defence coach

Hawkins returned to Wales with Scarlets last year and started against New Zealand and South Africa in the autumn.

After being preferred to Cardiff's Ben Thomas against France last weekend, he lined up in between fly-half Dan Edwards and outside centre Eddie James for the first time at international level.

The trio, who have a total of 23 caps, could now face a well-oiled Scotland trio of Finn Russell, Sione Tuipulotu and Huw Jones.

They toured Australia with the British and Irish Lions last summer ‚Äì joining forces in the XV in the first Test ‚Äì and have a combined tally of 186 international outings for Scotland.

France caused Wales all manner of problems with ball in hand and another tough defensive examination is coming.

"They've got quite a settled centre partnership, so whoever gets the chance this is a good test," said Hawkins.

"Tuipulotu's obviously a powerful ball carrier, but he's got nice subtle skills as well. Huw Jones has got a bit of gas and some nice running lines, so they complement each other well."

The Glasgow combination could be going up against a Scarlets duo if Hawkins and James hold off the challenge of Thomas and fit-again Ospreys centre Owen Watkin.

James, 23 and 6ft 3ins, showed signs of promise with ball in hand against Les Bleus.

"He had an injury during the off season and since he has come back for the Scarlets he has been really physical in the carry and in defence," said Hawkins, who also partnered James for Wales Under-20s.

"He has brought that into the Six Nations and he is a big man. When you've got people like that in the team you just want to get them on the ball as much as possible."

After shipping 15 tries and 102 points in the first two rounds, Wales clearly have work to do in defence.

However, Hawkins' playmaking abilities are key to them also posing more questions in attack.

"We talk a lot about being a team that can excite the nation," said the centre, who featured at fly-half for Scarlets in the first half of the season.

"A lot of the best teams in the world believe in their style of game and wouldn't change. France double down on that and they are one of the best in the world.

"After a couple of disappointing results it's not the time to go away from what is working, or going to work, for us moving forward. We just need to keep banging the drum."

title: Juventus defender Gleison Bremer doubtful vs Roma
description: Bad news for Luciano Spalletti and his Juventus. During the first half of the Champions League match against Galatasaray, the Juventus coach was without Gleison Bremer. The experienced Brazilian defen...
fullText:
Bad news for Luciano Spalletti and his Juventus.

During the first half of the Champions League match against Galatasaray, the Juventus coach was without Gleison Bremer.

The experienced Brazilian defender left the field in the 33rd minute due to injury.

During a collision with a player from the Istanbul team, the former Torino player suffered a blow to his right leg. Federico Gatti came on in his place.

The injury suffered by Bremer against Galatasaray could directly affect Roma. In two league games, Gian Piero Gasperini‚Äôs Giallorossi will host Spalletti‚Äôs team at the Olimpico.

In the next few hours, the defender will undergo medical tests to determine the extent of the leg injury and his recovery time.

Before Roma, Juventus will face Como in the league and Galatasaray in the return match.

title: Xavier Booker talks return to East Lansing following loss to MSU
description: Xavier Booker spoke with the media about his return to East Lansing following UCLA's loss to Michigan State.
fullText:
Michigan State welcomed in UCLA on Tuesday night, where the Spartans bounced back in a big way against the Bruins, dominating them en route to a 82-59 win.

Other than the game, it was the return of Xavier Booker, who was playing his first game inside of the Breslin Center since departing the program via the transfer portal.

In his return, Booker was met warmly by the Spartans fan base, so much so that Tom Izzo mentioned this in his post game press conference. Booker himself, following the game, spoke about his return to East Lansing.

Booker talked about the emotions he felt in this game, talking about the relationships he had with the Spartans program and what he sees in the Michigan State program.

See what Booker had to say via X:

"I definitely have a lot of love for Spartan Nation, the coaching staff, and my teammates."

description: Liam Rosenior met with Joao Pedro more than any other player and has really helped with his confidence according to journalist Matt Law.DOWNLOAD THE OFFICIAL CHELSEA NEWS APP FOR ALL THE LATEST UPDATE...
fullText:
Liam Rosenior met with Joao Pedro more than any other player and has really helped with his confidence according to journalist Matt Law.

DOWNLOAD THE OFFICIAL CHELSEA NEWS APP FOR ALL THE LATEST UPDATES ‚Äì STRAIGHT TO YOUR PHONE! ON THE APP STORE

Pedro joined Chelsea last summer from Brighton in a deal worth an initial ¬£55m, and made an instant impact at the Club World Cup.

The Brazilian scored in both the semi final and the final of the competition, and took that form into the start of the Premier League season.

He went through a difficult period under Enzo Maresca towards the end of last year, where he clearly struggled for form.

It was unclear whether he was best as a number nine or ten, but since Rosenior has come in his form has improved drastically.

Pedro has been in brilliant form under Rosenior. (Photo by Mike Hewitt/Getty Images)

The attacker has now scored ten league goals, to match his tally at Brighton from last season, and is thriving under the 41-year-old.

Rosenior has praised Pedro on numerous occasions since he arrived, and Law has revealed the new head coach met with the 24-year-old more than any other player.

‚ÄúHe [Rosenior] met with Joao Pedro more than any other player,‚Äù he told The London Is Blue Podcast.

‚ÄúI Always thought Maresca talked him down as a nine, maybe that impacted him.

‚ÄúRosenior seems to really talk him up as a nine. That seems to have given Joao Pedro a massive jolt of confidence.‚Äù

Whilst Pedro is thriving on the pitch, he also seems to be striking up a good on pitch relationship with Cole Palmer.

Matt Law reveals what Liam Rosenior has done to give Chelsea ace ‚Äúmassive jolt of confidence‚Äù

‚ÄúThey‚Äôve been changing players‚Äù ‚Äì Former Chelsea player wants stability at the club

Chelsea looking into signing 6ft 3in 29-year-old centre back in the summer window

Palmer revealed how much he enjoys playing with Pedro, and we haven‚Äôt seen enough of the duo together this season due to the England international‚Äôs injury problems.

The thought of the pair linking up on a regular basis for the remainder of the season is an exciting one, and one Chelsea supporters will hope can take them to Champions League qualification.

title: LCD-as-Aperture: A Computer That Fits Inside a Camera Lens
description: For a long while, digital single-lens reflex (DSLR) cameras were the king of the castle for professional and amateur photography. They brought large sensors, interchangeable lenses, and professiona‚Ä¶
fullText:
For a long while, digital single-lens reflex (DSLR) cameras were the king of the castle for professional and amateur photography. They brought large sensors, interchangeable lenses, and professional-level viewfinders to the digital world at approachable prices, and then cemented their lead when they started being used to create video as well. They‚Äôre experiencing a bit of a decline now, though, as mirrorless cameras start to dominate, and with that comes some unique opportunities. To attach a lens meant for a DSLR to a mirrorless camera, an adapter housing must be used, and [Ancient] found a way to squeeze a computer and a programmable aperture into this tiny space.

The programmable aperture is based on an LCD screen from an old cell phone. LCD screens are generally transparent until their pixels are switched, and in most uses as displays a backer is put in place so someone can make out what is on the screen. [Ancient] is removing this backer, though, allowing the LCD to be completely transparent when switched off. The screen is placed inside this lens adapter housing in the middle of a PCB where a small computer is also placed. The computer controls the LCD via a set of buttons on the outside of the housing, allowing the photographer to use this screen as a programmable aperture.

The LCD-as-aperture has a number of interesting uses that would be impossible with a standard iris aperture. Not only can it function as a standard iris aperture, but it can do things like cycle through different areas of the image in sequence, open up arbitrary parts or close off others, and a number of other unique options. It‚Äôs worth checking out the video below, as [Ancient] demonstrates many of these effects towards the end. We‚Äôve seen some of these effects before, although those were in lenses that were mechanically controlled instead.

Thanks to [kemfic] for the tip!

title: Jeffrey Epstein Inquired About Toxic Plant That Produces Drug That Blocks Free Will, Emails Show
description: New Epstein Files emails mention toxic Angel‚Äôs Trumpet plants and scopolamine, a drug tied to memory loss and confusion.
fullText:
Freshly released documents tied to Jeffrey Epstein are raising new and unsettling questions.

In the latest batch of released Epstein Files, uncovered emails per TMZ show Epstein asking about his ‚Äútrumpet plants at nursery.‚Äù While the reference might have seemed harmless‚Äîexperts noted that Angel‚Äôs Trumpet plants are extremely toxic and produce a drug called scopolamine.

Scopolamine has gained notoriety for its disturbing effects. Per Science Direct, the substance is known to impair memory and decision-making, and severe intoxication reportedly may even cause paralysis and death. ‚ÄúIn cases of overdose, result in toxic symptoms such as dry mucous membranes, tachycardia, confusion, and hallucinations,‚Äù the outlet states.

Notably, the drug is used pharmacologically‚Äîthough rarely‚Äîto treat motion sickness and nausea. But perhaps most alarming, scopolamine reportedly doesn't show up on toxicology reports.

According to the document release, Epstein also received an article detailing the effects of scopolamine and the plant it comes from, suggesting he may have been aware of its properties.

Epstein died in 2019 while awaiting trial on federal sex-trafficking charges. Since then, court-ordered releases of documents have continued in waves. Lawmakers voted to force President Donald Trump‚Äôs Department of Justice to publicly release the Epstein Files, though the DOJ has indicated there are no further batches expected.

The broader files have drawn attention not only for their contents, but for the high-profile names mentioned throughout‚Äîincluding figures such as Elon Musk, Deepak Chopra, and Bill Gates, among other prominent individuals in business and entertainment.

And just last week, Epstein‚Äôs former associate Ghislaine Maxwellinvoked the Fifth Amendment during a deposition before the House Oversight Committee when asked about associations involving Trump and Epstein. At this time, Trump has not been accused of any crime in relation to Epstein.

title: Lakers center Deandre Ayton detained, released at Bahamas airport over suspected marijuana possession
description: Ayton's lawyer said the marijuana was actually in someone else's bag.
fullText:
Los Angeles Lakers center Deandre Ayton was detained and quickly released on Tuesday on suspicion of possessing a small amount of marijuana at Lynden Pindling International Airport in the Bahamas, according to Reuters.

Ayton would have been returning to the United States from his native Bahamas as the All-Star break nears its end.

In an initial report from TMZ, the central division of the Royal Bahamas Police Force claimed Ayton was searched after he was spotted smoking marijuana at the airport. Reuters also reports Ayton was found with the drug, which is still illegal in the Bahamas.

However, his lawyer Devard Francis said the suspected marijuana was actually in someone else's bag and that Ayton was never arrested or charged, via Reuters:

"The investigators saw that the actual very small amount of marijuana wasn't in Deandre's bag, but they still went through their investigations and he was released expeditiously," Francis said.

Ayton, a former No. 1 overall pick, is in his first season with the Lakers, who signed him to a two-year, $16.6 million deal. He entered the All-Star break averaging 13.2 points on 67.5% shooting and a team-high 8.5 rebounds per game.

title: Prosecutors drop racketeering case against New Jersey Democratic power broker, co-defendants
description: New Jersey's acting attorney general said Tuesday she will not ask the state Supreme Court to review the dismissal of racketeering charges against Democratic power broker George E. Norcross III and th...
fullText:
New Jersey's acting attorney general said Tuesday she will not ask the state Supreme Court to review the dismissal of racketeering charges against Democratic power broker George E. Norcross III and those charged alongside him.

The decision by Jennifer Davenport, who was recently appointed by new Gov. Mikie Sherrill, came nearly three weeks after a three-judge appellate panel upheld a state judge's decision to toss the criminal charges. The indictment had been obtained by Matt Platkin, who served as attorney general under Sherrill's predecessor and fellow Democrat Phil Murphy.

‚ÄúIn light of the Appellate Division‚Äôs decision, we have concluded that our prosecutorial resources would be best spent on other matters," the attorney general's office said in a statement. ‚ÄúOur office remains committed to prioritizing public corruption prosecutions in this time of deepening mistrust in government.‚Äù

The charges stemmed from a June 2024 indictment announced by Platkin at a news conference at which Norcross himself took the unusual step of appearing in person and sitting directly in front of the attorney general.

Norcross and five other defendants were accused of running ‚Äúan enterprise‚Äù going back to 2012 to use their political influence to craft legislation to serve their own interests. But in a nearly 100-page ruling, the state judge found the prosecution‚Äôs allegations did not amount to criminal coercion or extortion and are time-barred.

Norcross and his lawyers have long maintained his innocence, claiming the indictment was politically motivated, an allegation Platkin has repeatedly denied.

Norcross, who served as executive chairman of the insurance firm Conner Strong & Buckelew, has been widely viewed as among the most influential unelected Democrats in the state. He was a Democratic National Committee member until 2021 and previously served as the head of the Camden County Democratic Party.

title: Bowie ISD approves student transfers to nearby districts
description: After a school board meeting, Bowie Independent School District will continue allowing interlocal transfers of students.
fullText:
BOWIE (KFDX/KJTL) ‚Äî After a school board meeting, Bowie Independent School District will continue allowing transfers of students amongst neighboring school districts.

At the Bowie ISD School Board meeting on Monday, Feb. 16, parents voiced their opinions on the state of the district, citing concerns ranging from district performance to student safety. Parents said their concerns caused them to remove their children from Bowie schools altogether.

Parents have had the right to decide if they wanted their children to attend one of the four neighboring districts, despite where they reside. If accepted by that school, a bus would travel into Bowie to pick the child up.

The board had previously said they might no longer allow buses from other districts to travel into Bowie‚Äôs district, sparking a public outcry that came to a head at Monday‚Äôs school board meeting.

Texas Top 10 Most Wanted offender captured in Bowie

The meeting was packed, with multiple parents sharing their reasons for removing their children from the district.

Among the biggest concerns raised was bullying, and Bowie parent Michelle Parker expressed her frustration during the public comment section of the meeting.

‚ÄúMy daughter was being bullied on a daily [basis], and the teachers, the principal, the superintendent would not listen. I was going to them. I was talking to them. I was making the phone calls. I was being the active parent, and they did not listen,‚Äù Parker said. ‚ÄúThey didn‚Äôt hear a word I said. My daughter was literally dragged down the bleachers by her hoodie, and the only excuse I got was because the boys were bored.‚Äù

Parker told board members after trying the get the issue resolved and feeling ignored, she felt the only option was to have her child transfer schools. She said after speaking with other families, she learned her experience is not isolated.

‚ÄúWe choose to take our kids somewhere else because we as parents want what‚Äôs best for our kids. They don‚Äôt address what‚Äôs important for our kids. They‚Äôre not addressing the bullying that‚Äôs going on in schools,‚Äù Parker said. ‚ÄúThose of us parents who have gone up the ladder to try to address it have been completely ignored. They don‚Äôt listen.‚Äù

Ben Franklin Elementary plans centennial celebration event

After hearing public comments, the board voted to enter an interlocal bussing agreement with four surrounding school districts, continuing to allow those districts to pick up Bowie area students who voluntarily enroll elsewhere.

‚ÄúI was elected to look after the needs of every student. I understand that in today‚Äôs society, parents have the right to send their child wherever they want to, and I respect that,‚Äù Bowie ISD Board member Jeff Jackson said. ‚ÄúHowever, once a student chooses to attend another school, I as a trustee, and we as a board no longer have an obligation to them. Our obligation is to the students who want to attend Bowie schools.‚Äù

District leaders said they acknowledge parent concerns and say improving student experiences remains a priority.

The districts that are set to be included in the agreement are Goldberg, Montague, Forestburg and Bellevue ISD. Details of the interlocal agreements still have to be finalized.

You can now stream KFDX and Texoma‚Äôs FOX live 24/7 on your smart TV¬†with¬†KFDX+,¬†our brand-new app! No antenna, cable, or satellite needed‚Äîwatch for free, anytime.¬†Just download it on your Roku, Apple TV, or Fire TV and start streaming.

title: Social media users swoon over Burbank police officer¬†in viral Instagram post
description: It is unknown whether the Burbank Police Department expected such a reaction to one of its recent Instagram posts, but it sure has taken off. BPD posted on Feb. 13 a photo of a member of their ranks, ...
fullText:
It is unknown whether the Burbank Police Department expected such a reaction to one of its recent Instagram posts, but it sure has taken off.

BPD posted on Feb. 13 a photo of a member of their ranks, Officer Parks,¬†after he encountered a¬†pair of French Bulldogs during a¬†call¬†for service.

‚ÄúHe could not resist petting, holding and snapping a photo with them!‚Äù the department said in the post‚Äôs caption. ‚ÄúPolice officers love dogs.‚Äù

What started as a routine cute photo-op quickly became something else, however, as social media users flocked to the comment section not to comment on the¬†Frenchies¬†‚Äì one being held by Officer Parks and the other appearing to relieve itself behind him ‚Äì but to comment on Officer Parks himself.

The post, as of Tuesday morning, sat at over 200,000 likes. For context, the BPD Instagram post before the one with Officer Parks ‚Äì a job posting¬†‚Äì got less than 100. Over 3,000 people commented on the post, mostly on Officer Parks‚Äô looks.

The most-liked ones were quite creative:

‚ÄúI just lost my dogs in Burbank requesting Officer Parks‚Äô help,‚Äù one person said.

‚ÄúIs Officer Parks available for a completely professional, absolutely necessary pat-down?‚Äù another asked.

‚ÄúI identify as a dog if Officer park wants to pick me up too,‚Äù said a third.

Some even went as far as to accuse themselves of (hopefully) fake crimes in the hopes Officer Parks would respond.

‚ÄúI stole $2,000 worth of items from Target. I dare you to arrest me I‚Äôm in the parking lot by the 3rd light post towards the back next to the black Honda,‚Äù a user quipped.

‚ÄúI committed a crime, please come arrest me,‚Äù said another.

Some users opted for other humorous comments.

‚ÄúAin‚Äôt nobody looking at that cat,‚Äù said one person.

‚ÄúNah y‚Äôall wrong for dropping his name but not his number,‚Äù said another.

The police department clearly noticed the virality, liking some of the comments pertaining to Officer Parks‚Äô looks ‚Äî including ‚ÄúThis cop out here servin‚Äô the people AND servin‚Äô looks!‚Äù and ‚ÄúOoof he has handcuffs‚Äù ‚Äî and another posted by a user who said the comment section had them ‚Äúin freaking tears.‚Äù

It was not immediately clear what Officer Parks thought of the messages.

title: Vonn, Shiffrin and Brignone among the Olympic skiers voicing concern over receding glaciers
description: CORTINA D'AMPEZZO, Italy (AP) ‚Äî Team USA skiers Lindsey Vonn and Mikaela Shiffrin, along with Italy's Federica Brignone, are among the many skiers who have expressed concern during these Olympic Games about the accelerating melt of the world‚Äôs glaciers.
fullText:
CORTINA D'AMPEZZO, Italy (AP) ‚Äî Team USA skiers Lindsey Vonn and Mikaela Shiffrin, along with Italy's Federica Brignone, are among the many skiers who have expressed concern during these Olympic Games about the accelerating melt of the world‚Äôs glaciers.

And Olympic host city Cortina is a fitting place for them to be talking about climate change: Glaciers once visible from town have dramatically shrunk. Many have been reduced to tiny glaciers or residual ice patches at high elevations among the jagged peaks of the Dolomites. Any Olympian or spectator wishing to lay eyes on a major glacier would have to take a long drive on winding mountain roads to the Marmolada. It's melting rapidly, too.

The world‚Äôs top skiers train on glaciers because of the high-quality snow there, and a warming world jeopardizes the future of their sport. Vonn started skiing on glaciers in Austria when she was just 9 years old.

‚ÄúMost of the glaciers that I used to ski on are pretty much gone,‚Äù 41-year-old Vonn said Feb. 3 in response to a question from The Associated Press at a prerace press conference in Cortina before she crashed on the Olympic downhill course. ‚ÄúSo that‚Äôs very real and it‚Äôs very apparent to us.‚Äù

As athletes in snow sports, Shiffrin said, they ‚Äúget a real front-row view‚Äù to the monumental changes underway atop some of the world‚Äôs highest, coldest peaks.

‚ÄúIt is something that‚Äôs very close to our heart, because it is the heart and soul of what we do,‚Äù Shiffrin told AP after racing Sunday. ‚ÄúI would really, really like to believe and hope that with strong voices and sort of broader policy changes within companies and governments, there is a hope for a future of our sport. But I think right now, it‚Äôs a little bit of a ... it‚Äôs a question.‚Äù

Italian glaciologist Antonella Senese said Italy has lost more than 200 square kilometers (77 square miles) of glacier area since the late 1950s.

‚ÄúWe are observing a continuous and uninterrupted decrease in glacier area and volume. In the last one to two decades, this reduction has clearly accelerated,‚Äù Senese, associate professor of physical geography in the University of Milan's environmental science and policy department, said in an interview.

Among the peaks surrounding Cortina d‚ÄôAmpezzo, there are glaciers on the slopes of the Cristallo and Sorapiss mountains. The 2015 New Italian Glacier Inventory found these glaciers shrunk by about one-third since the 1959-1962 inventory.

Shortly after winning a second gold Sunday at her home Winter Olympics, Brignone told AP that skiing is ‚Äútotally different‚Äù now than when she was younger. Brignone lives in the Valle d‚ÄôAosta, about six hours away.

When she sees how glaciers are retreating to higher elevations, Brignone said she‚Äôs not thinking about the future of skiing ‚Äî she‚Äôs concerned for the future of the planet.

‚ÄúThere we have a lot of glaciers, but they are going up and up, every year, more and more,‚Äù she told AP.

Yet many people who don't frequent the mountains remain unaware of what's at stake, so the University of Innsbruck created the Goodbye Glaciers Project. The loss of glaciers has far-reaching consequences, threatening water sources, increasing mountain hazards and contributing to sea level rise.

The project shows how different warming levels change the amount of ice left on selected glaciers around the world. To be included, glaciers must have an estimated 2020 volume of at least 0.01 cubic kilometers. The Cristallo and Sorapiss glaciers no longer meet that threshold, said Patrick Schmitt, a doctoral student at the University of Innsbruck.

Some 50 kilometers (31 miles) from Cortina is the Marmolada glacier, one of the largest glaciers in Italy and the largest in the Dolomites. An apartment building-sized chunk of the glacier detached in July 2022, sparking an avalanche of debris that killed 11 hikers. The mountain is popular for hiking in summer and skiing in winter.

The University of Padua said in 2023 the glacier had been halved over 25 years.

It's expected to be mostly gone by 2034 if the world warms 2.7 Celsius (4.9 Fahrenheit), according to the Goodbye Glaciers Project. But if warming is limited to 1.5 C (2.7 F ‚Äî the international goal ‚Äî the glacier‚Äôs life could be extended by another six years, and around 100 glaciers in the Alps can be saved, Schmitt said.

‚ÄúCutting greenhouse gas emissions now will reduce future ice loss and soften the impacts on people and nature,‚Äù Schmitt wrote in an email. ‚ÄúThe choices we make in this decade will decide how much ice remains in the Dolomites, across the Alps, and around the world.‚Äù

Globally, more than 7 trillion tons of ice (6.5 trillion metric tons) has been lost since 2000, according to a study last year. And the prospective impact of climate change on Olympic sport is enormous; the list of places that could host Winter Games is projected to shrink substantially in the coming years.

In Cortina, Noa Szollos, who is competing for Israel, said in an interview the state of the nearby glaciers speaks to the condition of glaciers around the world.

‚ÄúI hope we can do something about it,‚Äù she said, ‚Äúbut it‚Äôs a hard time.‚Äù

Silja Koskinen of Finland said in an interview she can‚Äôt train on some of the glaciers she used to because of crevices, rocks and flowing water. Team USA skier AJ Hurt talked about starting the season in October on glaciers in S√∂lden, Austria.

‚ÄúEvery year, I feel like we come and there‚Äôs a little less snow. And every time, we‚Äôre like, are we really going to start in October? There‚Äôs no snow here,'‚Äù Hurt told the AP. ‚ÄúIt is really sad and it‚Äôs hard to ignore in this sport, definitely, when we‚Äôre around it so much and it is so clear.‚Äù

Norwegian skier Nikolai Schirmer is leading an effort to stop fossil fuel companies from sponsoring winter sports. Burning coal, oil and gas is the largest contributor to global climate change by far.

In Bormio, Italy, Team USA skier River Radamus said athletes ‚Äî as stewards of outdoor winter sports‚Äî should be on the forefront of trying to defend the environment as best they can.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs always present in our mind that we‚Äôre on a dangerous trend unless we do something right,‚Äù Radamus said.

AP Sports Writer Pat Graham contributed from Bormio, Italy.

AP Winter Olympics coverage: https://apnews.com/hub/milan-cortina-2026-winter-olympics

The Associated Press‚Äô climate and environmental coverage receives financial support from multiple private foundations. AP is solely responsible for all content. Find AP‚Äôs standards for working with philanthropies, a list of supporters and funded coverage areas at AP.org.

title: Fetterman says he doesn‚Äôt know why Trump, GOP aren‚Äôt working to ‚Äòlock down‚Äô Texas Senate seat
description: Sen. John Fetterman (D-Pa.) on Tuesday questioned why President Trump and other GOP lawmakers haven‚Äôt locked down the Texas Senate race with an endorsement in the three-way party primary. Sen. John Co...
fullText:
Sen. John Fetterman (D-Pa.) on Tuesday questioned why President Trump and other GOP lawmakers haven‚Äôt locked down the Texas Senate race with an endorsement in the three-way party primary.¬†

Sen. John Cornyn (R-Texas), Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton (R) and Rep. Wesley Hunt (R-Texas) are vying for Cornyn‚Äôs seat in the Senate. The frequently nasty battle between Paxton and Cornyn has left some Democrats thinking it could create an opening for their party in November, particularly if Paxton wins.

Fetterman said he thinks his party can regain the House but argued the battle to retake the Senate majority will be an uphill one during an appearance on Fox Business Network‚Äôs ‚ÄúMornings with Maria.‚Äù

He also argued that Trump and the GOP are putting Texas in play by not backing Cornyn.

‚ÄúI mean, as you point out, the margin is very close. And there‚Äôs always ‚Äî history always tells us there‚Äôs a backlash against the party in power. ‚Ä¶ So I think most people would have assumed that the House is going to flip. Now, here in the Senate, that‚Äôs a little more difficult, and now you have other races in play,‚Äù he told host Maria Bartiromo.

‚ÄúFor me, like for Texas, for example, Cornyn is a reasonable Republican, and now that would be money in the bank. But now I don‚Äôt know why politically ‚Äî I‚Äôm not sure why the Republicans and the president wouldn‚Äôt sit on that and just lock down Texas. But for me, there‚Äôs other states that are in flux,‚Äù he added.

Democrats are having their own contentious primary in Texas between Rep. Jasmine Crockett and state Rep. James Talarico.

Fetterman has shared a dismal outlook on his party. On Tuesday, the Pennsylvania senator said Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez (N.Y.) is ‚Äúpart of the rot in the Democratic Party‚Äù for her foreign policy stance denouncing Israel amid the war in Gaza.

‚ÄúFor me, stand with Israel. I‚Äôll never vote for any kinds of restrictions on aid, whether it‚Äôs military, financial, or intelligence. There are never to be any restrictions on that. And now, for here we are, we can have peace. Again, that‚Äôs become part of the serious problem in our party,‚Äù Fetterman told Bartiromo.

He later added, ‚ÄúI refuse to pander to the part of my Democratic Party that finds that there‚Äôs value in being anti-Israel. And that‚Äôs effectively ‚Äî they use the word ‚Äòanti-Zionism‚Äô ‚Äî I mean, effectively what that‚Äôs really become on college campuses and places is just antisemitism. We have a problem here in our party, and I‚Äôm going to stand against that and always be an unapologetic supporter for Israel.‚Äù

title: Trump Stooge‚Äôs Bonkers Ballot Raid Shredded in Humiliating Court Filing
description: Georgia officials have shredded the FBI‚Äôs justification for seizing Fulton County‚Äôs 2020 voter rolls, writing in a new filing that their evidence fell ‚Äúwoefully short‚Äù of showing probable cause. In a ...
fullText: Georgia officials have shredded the FBI‚Äôs justification for seizing Fulton County‚Äôs 2020 voter rolls, writing in a new filing that their evidence fell ‚Äúwoefully short‚Äù of showing probable cause. In a petition demanding the return of 2020 election ballots, officials accused the FBI of having ‚Äúserious‚Äù omissions in its successful petition for a search warrant to raid the county‚Äôs election office near Atlanta. ‚ÄúInstead of alleging probable cause to believe a crime has been committed, the affidavit does nothing more than describe the types of human errors that its own sources confirm occur in almost every election‚Äîwithout any intentional wrongdoing whatsoever,‚Äù the filing says.

title: Milwaukee bar accused of illegal tipping practices in new federal lawsuit
description: The suit alleges Steny's, 800 S. 2nd St., operates an unlawful mandatory tip pool and wrongfully claimed a tip credit it was not entitled to receive.
fullText:
Another well-known Milwaukee bar and restaurant is facing a federal lawsuit over tipping practices an employee says violated the Fair Labor Standards Act.

Steny's Tavern and Grill, doing business as Steny's, Inc., and its registered agent Jerome K. Stenstrup are named in the civil complaint filed by Nathan Witman, a Steny's front-of-house employee. The lawsuit was filed Feb. 12 in the Eastern District of Wisconsin.

The suit alleges Steny's, 800 S. 2nd St., operates an unlawful mandatory tip pool that includes kitchen workers, who do not customarily receive tips, and wrongfully claimed a tip credit it was not entitled to receive.

More: Cafe Corazon employees sue restaurant over tip pooling policy that included managers

A tip credit is a provision under the Fair Labor Standards Act that allows an employer to count a portion of a tipped employee's tips towards the employer's obligation to pay that employee per workweek an amount equal to the minimum wage and overtime compensation required under the FLSA. In Wisconsin, the minimum wage is $7.25.

Witman is one of at least 40 employees affected by the tip pool, the lawsuit says.

Stenstrup did not immediately return a message seeking comment on the lawsuit. Steny's operates two locations, the Walker's Point restaurant named in the suit and a location in Pewaukee.

A similar lawsuit alleging illegal tipping practices at the St. Paul Fish Company's Milwaukee Public Market location was filed in January. That suit claims the seafood restaurant illegally allowed its managers to take tips set aside for other restaurant workers.

This article originally appeared on Milwaukee Journal Sentinel: Milwaukee bar Steny's accused of illegal tipping practices in lawsuit
